Players must use their hand of three Inspector cards to uncover clues about the five key suspects, procure the necessary evidence, and arrest the suspect with the highest total value (the most notorious criminal). But beware, certain actions corrupt, and the player with the most corruption automatically loses!

200124.name: Avalanche 2: Super Avalanche
200124.description:
Climb the falling blocks as you race to avoid the rising lava in this challenging arcade platformer!

Play as an exceptionally bouncy marshmallow as you dodge enemies, defeat colorful bosses, and try to avoid getting crushed. Buy power-ups from falling shops, collect missions, bank your coins, and purchase powerful game-changing upgrades.

Source: The Developer Website.

200125.name: Clusterfight!: And Whose Army? Expansion Pack
200125.description:
From the publisher:

Clusterfight is a party game of hypothetical battles for 3-12 players. If you've ever stayed up into the wee hours debating the finer points of Freddy vs. Jason, or Kirk vs. Picard, this game's for you. And seriously, who really thinks that the landmark case of Alien vs. Predator settled anything? Nobody even stopped to ask, "What if Predator had laser eyes?" Each round in Clusterfight, players throw combatants into the ring, then change the dynamics of the fight with "battle cards". Sure, Batman could beat up the Pope, but what if Batman was "Vomiting Uncontrollably" and the Pope was "Fighting Mad"? Everyone has a chance to bet on the outcome, then a judge decides the winner and bets are settled. When all players have judged twice, the player with the most points wins!

50 card expansion to the popular party game Clusterfight! New Battlegrounds, Items, Actions & Statuses and Fighters. All cards created by our Kickstarter backers.

200126.name: Pathfinder Map Pack: Road System
200126.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Road Goes Ever On and On! The archetypal fantasy epic is a journey, and some of the most exciting moments happen on the road. When adventurers meet a demon at a crossroads or ambush an enemy convoy carrying a kidnapped innocent, the Game Master shouldn't have to fill in the highway and clumps of wayside bushes. This Pathfinder Map Pack provides beautifully illustrated 5" × 8" map tiles that can be combined into a variety of roads and intersections. Inside, you'll find 18 richly crafted map tiles, including: Ambush Site, Crossroads, Muddy Stretch, Roadside Cairn, Stone Bridge, Wayside Copse. Game Masters shouldn't waste their time sketching maps whenever characters set out on a trip. With Pathfinder Map Pack: Road System, you'll always have dangers ready as your adventurers make their way into the wide world!

200127.name: Secrets of the Dust
200127.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"See the world!" they said from a London invaded by Axis forces to pre-Mayan ruins in the Amazon jungle, millennia-old secrets of the Dust universe await in all corners of the Earth. Embark on a whirlwind campaign that pits an elite Allied team against the Axis, SSU, remnant Nazis, and a secretive cult in a race for the legendary Seven Seals. Expansive and deep, Operation: Apocalypse will satisfy fans old and new alike. For use with the Dust Adventures roleplaying game as well.

200128.name: Spellblast
200128.description:
User Summary

Retro-themed shoot'em up that has you spelling short words while you shoot enemies. You must toggle through the word and put the letters in the correct order or die. There are late 20th century style bosses at the end while listening to early 21st century music.

200129.name: //Snowflake Tattoo//
200129.description:
User Summary

Set previously to //NPPD RUSH//, this game is heavy on confusing theme and graphics as well as heavy on theme and involved plot. You are searching for dollsteak in a maze, all the time carrying on a conversation with a disembodied entity.

200130.name: Showing Tonight:  Mindhunter's Incident
200130.description:
User Summary

You are a detective investigating the mystery of a missing film crew and strange sound waves.

200131.name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Bound By Law – Lucius Box Set
200131.description:
Box Set for Lucius Crew. It contains Lucius, The Scribe (Lucius's Totem), Captain Dashel (Henchman), Two Guild Lawyers, Two Guild Guards.

Lucius is a Guild/Neverborn master who concentrates on using and manipulating minions. He works well with guard and mimic models.

Set differs from first edition box set in being made of plastic instead of metal, with 2nd edition cards, and additional guard and lawyer, and the Scribe and does not contain Ryle.

200133.name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Burning Revelation – Kaeris Box Set
200133.description:
Crew box for Kaeris for the second edition. The box set contains Kaeris, Eternal Flame (Totem), Firestarter (Henchman), and three Fire Gamin.

The box set is for second edition and contains the plastic figures and associated crew cards.

200134.name: Malifaux Second Edition: Hog Wild – Ulix Box Set
200134.description:
Box set for Ulix's Crew for Malifaux 2nd Edition. The Box contains, Ulix, Penelope (Totem), Old Major (Henchman), Three Wild Boars.

All figures are in plastic with associated character and upgrade cards. Figures come unpainted and unassembled.

Ulix is a master for the Gremlins faction. He specializes in pigs and almost all his abilities, actions and upgrades are pig related.

200135.name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Take Back the Night – Molly Box Set
200135.description:
The Box Set for Molly. Contains Molly, Necrotic Machine (Totem), Phillip and the Nanny (Henchman), and three Crooligans.

Miniatures are unassembled on plastic sprues with associated character cards and upgrades. It differs substantially from the first edition in that, there are new plastic sculpts, 2nd edition cards and it contains Phillip and the Nanny and the Necrotic Machine, but does not contain a rogue necromancy.

Molly is a resurrectionist master and former belle of Seamus. She works well with Belle models and can summon them and either Horrors or Spirits with the appropriate upgrade.

200136.name: Ninja Dice: Mystic Kage Master
200136.description:
The most mysterious ninjas, mystics focus internal energy to tap into magic powers.

Includes a custom kage master die and character card.

Ninja Dice core game and Ninja Dice: Kage Masters expansion needed to play.

200137.name: Ninja Dice: Gunpowder Kage Master
200137.description:
What gunpowder ninjas lack in precision, they make up for in destructive force!

Includes a custom kage master die and character card.

Ninja Dice core game and Ninja Dice: Kage Masters expansion needed to play.

200139.name: AHHBANG!
200139.description:
User summary
AHHBANG! ("AHH!" is sound of a zombie growling. "BANG!" is sound of a cop shooting a gun. The name is created from these words.)

AHHBANG! is a speed card game where cops fight zombies to protect civilians.

Each player initially has seven cards (one civilian, two cops, three zombies, and one randomly-dealt special card). Each round, players play one card face down, then reveal them simultaneously. If number of zombies exceeds that of cops, all cops and civilians played are killed. If they survived, players gain five points for the civilian played, and one point for the cop. Play seven rounds and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
To "BANG!" of "AHH!"
警官がゾンビを撃ち殺すか、ゾンビが警官を食べるかを、数で決めるカードゲームです。

200140.name: Matadoon!
200140.description:
マタドーン (Matadoon!) is like a bull-fighting game, but the players aren't fighting the bull; instead they try to control the bull in order to hit the other players.

On the square grid of the game board, players take turns placing three of their four tiles face down, after which the bull starts running. The bull always goes straight, but when it steps on a tile, the tile is revealed and the bull's new direction is determined. When the bull hits a wall for the second time, it stops moving.

Use the tiles wisely to hit your opponent. A player falls prone and can no longer move once hit and is eliminated when hit for the second time. The last survivor wins the game.

Publisher's summary
牛「と」戦うのではなく、牛「で」戦う闘牛！
闘技場にマントチップを配置して、牛の動きを操り、対戦相手にぶつけろ！！

200141.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 19 - Reputation)
200141.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: Want more from your superheroes? Here you go, with Reputation!

200142.name: The Wizard's Magic Bag
200142.description:
From publisher blurb:

What does the Wizard of Oz have inside his Magic Bag? New magical rules and options for Adventures in Oz: Fantasy Roleplaying Beyond the Yellow Brick Road!

Add detail with expanded rules for Transmutation and battle magic, or get the rules out of your way and turn the power of friendship into magic. Explore the wonders of Oz with magic items drawn from the classic Oz novels, including some that blur the line between items and spells.

200143.name: Five Boxes
200143.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game? Avalon Games is here to help! Each issue of the Avalon’s Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers, and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

Each issue will showcase news items and new treasures, so get each and every issue and add to your magical collection.

200144.name: The Ethercoustic Theurge
200144.description:
From publisher blurb:

Begun the crowdsourcing has.

Interjection Games is proud to present its first product written entirely by an individual other than its owner. Back in March, I hosted an open initiative to my core fanbase to teach design fundamentals and slowly coax an idea of their choosing into reality. In return for that time investiture, I get to sell the final product and pay the author a percentage of the proceeds. Several people signed on, but Bennett Selchow, author of the new ethercoustic theurge prestige class, was the only individual to see a project through.

The ethercoustic theurge is a new 5-level prestige class for use with Strange Magic that mixes the composition and ethermagic systems together. In addition to the wacky abilities that come with the combination of music and space-time, the very existence of a theurge between these two systems of magic makes new builds light up by virtue of dual magic progression.

Product Features

thercoustic theurge prestige class
4 new feats
New design with Interjection Games quality, but without the biases of that same guy you've put up with for the last 100+ products

200145.name: Garbhan Stoutpint
200145.description:
From publisher blurb:

Snapshot Statement

Garbhan is a neutral male halfling with barbarian levels utilizing the urban barbarian archetype. He mixes social graces, stealth, unarmed combat, and melee prowess. He has a number of abilities allowing him to choose beneficial modifiers on rolls to adapt and overcome based upon his situation.

Product Overview

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

200146.name: Royal Class
200146.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most mortal leaders or young would-be kings and queens are represented by the aristocrat non-player character class. However, some princes or princesses are touched by a magical patron, fate itself, or some other eldritch power. Whether a jealous witch's curse or a fairy godmother's blessing, the royal is changed forever by the otherworldly. A savvy royal learns to turn the weight of her destiny to her advantage, for good or ill.

DESIGNED TO BE EXPERIENCE APPROPRIATE: The royal base class is specifically designed for younger children or new players in mind but also to be enjoyed by players of all ages and experience levels! It is constructed to streamline complex options and introduce core concepts while acting as a stepping stone toward more complicated Pathfinder RPG classes. Younger players will thoroughly enjoy playing a simplified class but more savvy beginners have the options to make decisions for themselves, and potentially explore the various archetypes available for the class. Finally, experienced or older players can make the class far more versatile and modular with the complex destiny rule.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee
200147.description: 1840: In Kanagawa, the great bay of Tokyo, the Master Hokusai decided to open a painting school to share his art with his disciples. You are one of these disciples, and more than anything, you want to prove yourself worthy of the “crazy, old artist”. Follow his teachings to expand your studio and paint your preferred subjects (Trees, Animals, Characters, Buildings), all while paying attention to the changing of the seasons in order to make the most harmonious print… the one that will become the work of your lifetime!
200147.name: Kanagawa
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys
Ep 042 – Essen Spiel 2016 Preview
Episode 1: Order of the Gilded Compass, Troyes, Automobiles, SeaFall, Kanagawa
HLG 11: Stilte voor de Storm
WIPNcast 138
[Jeux du mois] Kanagawa et Kodama

200148.name: 6 Degrees of Resolution
200148.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game essentially is a free-form exercise of layered storytelling. The game uses a single token (provided as a print-and-play component) and a single d30. In play, substitutes for either can be used. Characters are defined solely through narrative play.

200149.name: The Fifth Quadrant
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (Ricochet re-release) edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Ricochet re-release) edition
200149.description:
From the inlay:

Galactic Survey Vessel ORION is on a mission to map and explore the Hercules Cluster. After 20 years, the survey is almost complete apart from one small strange looking Nebula. The crew prepare to cross the intergalactic space by putting themselves into Sustained Low Energy Expenditure Process. However, during the intergalactic crossing, ORION is taken over by a force of strange alien mechanical beings - ZIMEN.

When the crew re-energise, they find that many of the ship's systems have been terminated, all the computers reprogrammed in an alien language and ZIMEN everywhere. Can the crew overcome these obstacles and regain control of ORION. Time is against them as the ship's energy drains away. They must all work together using all their inbuilt capacities in order to free themselves from the dreaded ZIMEN.

200150.name: Dice City: Crossroads
200150.description:
Roll, build and win! The gold from the All That Glitters expansion continues to add wealth to your city in Dice City: Crossroads. That wealth can now be used to invest in the arts, music, and new buildings. The citizens of Rolldovia are finding new ways to get around your city, and in turn making it a more thriving community, with taverns and guilds sprouting up everywhere to support their needs. Which way will your city turn next? It is fair to say you have reached a crossroads...

But which is the right way to once more roll, build, and win?

200152.name: Baggage Carousel
200152.description:
User summary:

This rules-light storytelling game involves one player assuming the role of an airport employee (essentially, the game master); other players assume the roles of travelers. Unfortunately for all, the travelers' luggage has sprung open during handling and the baggage carousel contains the random contents of luggage. Card draws disclose the exact nature of the luggage (in the game, often much more interesting than might be expected) and the characters then must claim the item as theirs and explain how they can prove it.

200153.name: Bonsai
200153.description:
A game of thought and artistry. Players are bonsai tree gardeners competing for the title of "Master Gardener."

Bonsai is a beautiful pattern matching tile-laying game where players use tiles to grow their tree and compete for the best overall submission.

Components:
24 Branch Tiles
12 Trunk Tiles
6 Large Trunk Tiles
20 Pattern Cards
7 Community Goal cards ("Ribbons")
5 Foliage "chits" of each player color
Turn Track
3 Bonsai Pots.

Players take turns selecting and adding a branch tile to their flower pot. Each tile has a color: red, green, or yellow. When players have created a pattern that corresponds to a pattern card in play, they obtain that pattern card. As the game progresses players are given the opportunity to add foliage to their tree, but only to certain branches. This foliage can also count towards color patterns.

Trunk tiles and Large trunk tiles are placed on top of branch tiles. Trunks are worth VP, and build your tree "up" visually, which is very satisfying.

This game is played over the course of 12 turns depicted on the turn track.

In the basic rules, players have a one-time use special power to trim their tree, or change the position of 1 tile. This happens more often in Advanced Play.

Scoring:
Scoring happens at the end of the game, when players easily count points for every pattern card completed, the number of visible points on tiles, and community goal cards. But watch out! If your tree has any spare branches, you're going to lose 1 point for each one!

200155.name: Gem Hunter
200155.description:
Gem Hunter is played on a 10x11 board but only the squares forming what looks like a capital E with 4 horizontal bars are used. Each part of the E is 2 squares wide and the horizontal bars are connected by pairs of "Crossing" squares. The other squares are Start, Barren, Miner/Prospector, Opal, Sapphire, Ruby, Emerald and Diamond.

There are 50 cards of each gem type with values 100-500 and 3 special decks -Prospector, Miner and Questions. Players start as a Propector and can graduate to a Miner by drawing the appropriate card from the Prospector deck and this increases their options - at a cost.

It is essentially a "throw die, move, follow instructions" game and even movement is restricted to a single path that winds all round the E.

The winner is the first to collect one of a number of specified gem sets.

200158.name: Alien Vs Predator: USCM Sentry Guns Expansion
200158.description:
From the Publisher:
Automatic and mathematically efficient - that's what matters most when it comes to automated Sentry Guns. They can be placed anywhere in matter of few minutes and will keep firing at terryfing rate with inhuman accuracy until there is no movement in their line of sight. If you are not friendly - you are dead.

Famous robot sentry from "Aliens" movie is finally available for AVP players as an add-on. Automated gun nests can be placed anytime in any place which extends game in whole new direction.

Box consits of:
2x resin miniatures
2x plastic bases
1x stat card

200159.name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Facehuggers
200159.description:
From the Publisher:

Facehugger is terrifying parasatoid which only purpose is to implant an embryo in victim's body by attaching itself to its mouth. While its strong tail and bony finger-alike limbs grip your throat, all you want is to grasp for air. And that's your last mistake you will ever make, when creature will get inside your body and turn you into Xenomorph's host.

Absolute classic monster from horror and sci-fi genre - the infamous Facehugger is available now as an add-on to core AVP The Hunt Begins game. Miniatures are Single Piece ones, that means no assembly is required.

Box consists of:
5x resin miniatures
1x card

200160.name: Alien Vs Predator: Predator Young Bloods Expansion
200160.description:
From the publisher:

Too young to be adult hunter, too old to not to try. Every Yautja needs to prove himself among other clan members as skilful fighter before can became respected warrior. Every Young Blood goes through same rite of passage - marking itself by acidic blood of killed Xenomorph. Many dies trying, but those who succeed are the ones recognised as equals by other clan members.

Straight from the Alien Versus Predator movie comes new squad of Predators. Each of them is different miniature and unique by design. Almost all are Single Pieced miniatures with no assembly required.

Box consists of:
3x resin miniatures
3x plastic bases
1x stat card

200161.name: Alien Vs Predator: Weyland Yutani Commandos Expansion
200161.description:
From the publisher:

The best what Company has to offer - at your disposal.

Box contains:
5x 32mm scaled miniatures
5x plastic bases
5x ping token
5x stat cards

200163.description: Draco Magi: Foil Dragon Cards was an optional 26 card upgrade pack during the Kickstarter campaign, that included foil versions of all the metallic dragons and the Rainbow dragon.
200163.name: Draco Magi: Foil Dragon Cards

200164.name: Bread Mold Might Be Medicine
200164.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by a few Attributes. Attributes have an associated die type (e.g., d8 or d12) that is used to resolve actions depending on that Attribute. The game primarily is focused on perceptions of reality and shared perceptions of normality.

The game was developed under the title Mr. Bond Takes a Holiday, subsequently Holiday at Bellevue, and finally published as Bread Mold Might Be Medicine.

200165.description: The Investor Card Promo Pack contains two new Investor Cards (Opulent Oprah and Royal Robins) that can be played with Stockpile.
200165.name: Stockpile: Investor Card Promo Pack #1 – Opulent Oprah and Royal Robins

200166.name: MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Multiplatform Game of the Year Nominee
200166.description:
Fight off zombie hordes with friends in the first multiplayer game in the Neptunia series, MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies for the PlayStation®Vita system and PlayStation®TV! Set in Gamicademi, Gamindustri’s academy for CPUs and CPU candidates, Blanc and friends must film a movie to save their school, fend off zombies, and look cute at the same time! Play with up to 4 friends or tag team with up to 4 characters, including new characters, Tamsoft and Uzume Tennouboshi, and familiar faces, Plutia, Peashy, Dengekiko, and Famitsu to Nep up some zombies! Additionally, you can stylize characters with accessories like glasses, eye patches, and masks to make sure you look extra cute while slaying!

Source: The Developer Website.

200167.description:
This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


Luke Cage: Power Man (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man)
Gwen Stacy: Spider-Ally
Mary Jane: Spider-Ally
200167.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Spider-Allies Promo Cards

200168.description:
This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Black Manta: Deep Sea Deviant (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League)
Lex Luthor: Legion of Doom
Scarecrow: Legion of Doom
200168.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Classic Legion of Doom Promo Cards

200169.description:
Dumpster Diver is a game of glorious trash digging, and turning that trash into treasure. This fast and easy card game is for 2-4 players and can be played in about 20 minutes.

Players search, buy, sell, draw, and dive to create hands. The goal is to have the most victory points at the end of the game. VPs are earned during each game round by playing rooms and assortments.

With colorful art and easy game play, Dumpster Diver is fun for the whole family.
200169.name: Dumpster Diver
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 71: Friday, September 30th
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 72: Monday, October 3rd

200170.description:
The last, fading light of hope lies behind the walls of Farrenroc, the city on the edge of Darkness. You've walked its stalwart streets, tasted of its determined harvests, and have in turn sworn your life to its defense. Death does not frighten you near so much as the thought of Farrenroc falling to Darkness.

And now, here you stand—at the gates of the last city, facing the uncertain lands beyond. As the distant drumming heralds the encroaching Darkness, you steel your weapons and ready your courage for a final defense of your ancestral home. The dark frontier awaits...

Fight back the oppressive forces of Darkness in Myth: Dark Frontier, a fully cooperative board game for 2-4 players. Take on the role of an iconic Myth hero in a desperate fight to protect the city of Farrenroc from the legions of Darkness that seek to despoil its holy walls.

Heroes will have to travel, fight, and quest in defense of their city, while also establishing strongholds throughout the surrounding lands to provide crucial resources to Farrenroc. Each hero is equipped with a unique deck of action cards, providing unique ways to perform the standard actions...as long as Fate is on their side.

Meanwhile, the forces of Darkness spread across the land, methodically crippling Farrenroc's influence in hopes of eventually laying siege to this last standing beacon of Light. Each game of Dark Frontier pits the heroes against a sinle army, contributing its own unique minions, captains, boss, and treacheries. Heroes must contend with these threats while also mustering the support of the land to unite against a mutual foe.

Dark Frontier combines high adventure with resource management, programmed action selection, and epic conquest to create a unique gaming experience to further enrich the world of Myth.

Players take on the role of iconic heroes from the world of Myth, aiding the besieged city of Farrenroc in its never-ending quest to push back the Darkness. Each hero has a small deck of five actions: Travel, Battle, Encounter, Fortify, and Quest. Three of the five are selected and placed in one of three time slots (morning, day, and night). These selections are made for all heroes and the enemy at the same time, then shuffled. Each time phase is played out by drawing and executing the action, be it a hero or an enemy. Oftentimes the timing of these actions is important to accomplish a quest or encounter, or to push back invading forces. Players will need to discuss their planned actions with each other and play them in the appropriate time slots. All the while, the enemy is moving to destroy Farrenroc by any means necessary.
200170.name: Myth: Dark Frontier
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 036 – Blood Rage vs Scythe

boardgameimplementation: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
boardgameintegration: Legendary: Villains – A Marvel Deck Building Game
Legendary: Villains – A Marvel Deck Building Game
200171.description:
Description from the publisher:

Become Legendary with the mystical arts seen in the cult hit film Big Trouble in Little China!

In the deck-building game Legendary: Big Trouble in Little China, players work their way through the co-op game trying to defeat Lo Pan and the three storms! Play as Jack Burton, Gracie Law, Wang Chi, and even the Pork Chop Express as you play schemes straight from the film.
200171.name: Legendary: Big Trouble in Little China
boardgamepodcastepisode: MN 0133 Seven Games Reviewed in 30 Minutes - Quadralegthimotcovok

200172.name: Skyways
200172.description:
This two-player game says on the board that it was "approved by United Airlines" and appears to have been developed as marketing tool. The back of the board features a large picture of a United Airlines two-engine "Mainliner". The front of the board features a UAL logo. And the playing surface - a map of the United States overlaid with a grid of squares 13 wide and 9 deep, seems to include UAL's entire route map in red lines - even though these lines have nothing to do with the game.

Each player has five planes and starts from either New York or San Francisco. Each player must also pick up 10 pieces of baggage en route to the opposite base city. At the start of the game, each player puts the other player's baggage in the most inconvenient pattern possible, since the goal is to be the first player to reach the destination city with all five planes having picked up all 10 bags.

A player may move each plane only one square, either directly or diagonally ahead. Moves North and South are only allowed in the home airport bands on either coast, and planes may never move backward toward their starting airport. If a plane of either player is adjacent in a legal direction, the moving player may jump over the other plane as in checkers but without removing it. Jumps are free moves, and multiple jumps are allowed, followed by a final square forward as usual.

Success depends on artful placing of the opponent's bags, careful planning of a five-plane route that will both reach all bags and enable as many jumps as possible.

200173.name: Panda Craves Danger
200173.description:
Panda Craves Danger is a game all about eating weird, and often dangerous, things that more intelligent beings would steer clear of. Why you ask? You are a panda, an adorable, achingly cute ball of fur with only one problem: You and your fellow pandas have grown tired of bamboo and are craving something more exciting. The trouble is, you don't know much, so you have a hard time telling what's food and what's not.

Enter the the Danger Buffet! A line-up of some of the most exciting, er, "foods" that you have ever seen. Throw caution to the wind and eat everything in sight, but be careful — the world is full of dangerous things, and you may end up biting off more than you can chew.

Using a set of 12 custom danger dice, each panda takes turns alternating between eating dangers from the buffet in front of them and resting to heal up and to digest (score) the dangers they've consumed with the goal of digesting a combination of dangers worth the most prestige by end of game.

200174.description:
This Exotic Predator Add-on Expansion cards released in the second Kickstarter includes additional cards and Alphas for the Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus decks.

Quetzalcoatlus is a very specialized predator relying heavily on critical ambushes or swarming the skies with Drones and the Commander. Planning ahead is a requirement for this Apex to stand a chance against bigger predators.

Apex Deck Difficulty : Brutal




Sarcosuchus is a nasty, strictly-ambush predator. Ambushing is an absolute must along with hoarding every bit of food to expand your species. Ambush, hibernate, and grow is the key with this Apex.

Apex Deck Difficulty : Brutal





Note: Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus Apex Decks from Exotic Predators Limited Edition are required in order to play as Quetzalcoatlus or Sarcosuchus species.
200174.name: Apex TDBG: Exotic Predators Add-On – Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus Expansion Cards

200175.name: Hurry Home
200175.description:
According to the rules, Hurry Home was designed by J. W. Patterson, whose most famous game was the 1939 hit Contack. Described as "72 miles of hilarious enjoyment", this race game has three twists.

First, the circular course from Home to Town and back again is laid out in three lanes: Red (inner), Yellow (middle) and Green (outer). Second, the game uses a very large 12-sided die with color-coded numbers: 1-4 are red; 5-8 are yellow; and 9-12 are green. Finally, players may only move counter-clockwise on the yellow and red tracks, and must move the opposite direction on green.

Players choose one of seven vehicles: train, plane, bus, car, scooter, bicycle and horse-drawn buggy, but their mode has no bearing on their speed. Each player roles the die and must move on that color track in the direction indicated. If this requires moving sideways to get to the right track, each such move counts against the total: so a player on the red track who rolls green 9 must first spend two points to go sideways to green and then 7 points clockwise.

Player counters block movement by other players, whether sideways or around the track. First player to pass town and then home wins. A variant allows each player three rolls per turn, with the first two being optional and the final one compulsory (even if one or two previous were accepted and moved).

200176.name: New York World's Fair Children's Card Game
200176.description:
This very simple children's card game was published as a souvenir sold at the 1964/65 World's Fair in New York.

The 36-card deck features photographs of some of the fair's pavilions and exhibits. Players deal out the deck face down on the table and take turns turning over two cards. Cards that match are captured; those that don't are turned face down again. Winner is the player to capture the most cards.

200177.name: Drow and Giants
200177.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bolglandia is a realm once dominated by various giant warlords. Now under the subjugation of the Drow Empire, “freedom from the drow” implies a return to the tyranny of the giants. A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th edition adventure for 1-8 16th level characters. Episode 16 in the Drow Conspiracy.

200178.name: Drow Counterstrike
200178.description:
From publisher blurb:

It has been several days since the PCs survived the multiple attacks on their lives. One demon has been removed from power but the Drow Empire remains an active and potent threat. They will not wait idly for the heroes’ next move. A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th edition adventure for 1-8 18th level characters. Episode 18 in the Drow Conspiracy.

200179.name: Musklageta Campaign Guide
200179.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strategically built on the edge of the mysterious Vahs Stand, Musklageta was founded to thwart threats which emerge from the Shadowfell and the Feywild. It has grown to be a secure location to house threats too dangerous to the One True Faith and humanity to be left unattended. A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Supplement for 11th to 16th level characters.

200180.name: Out of Odill
200180.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Odill, there is a dangerous accumulation of powerful tools that have been confiscated from evil entities. The time has come to transport these potent items and creatures to the stronghold of Musklageta. A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 11th level characters. The first episode in the Legends of Musklageta Arc.

200181.name: Protectors in Need
200181.description:
From publisher blurb:

Musklageta is the repository for the most potent threats known to the One True Faith, humanity, and Dimgaard as a whole. For generations, Musklageta has been secured by the Knight Protectors of the Faith, but dark forces have neutralized the Knight Protectors leaving Musklageta vulnerable – and by extension all Dimgaard is at risk. A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 11th level characters. Episode 3 in the Legends of Musklageta.

200182.name: APA-L (Issue 493 - Oct 1974)
200182.description:
APA-L
493rd Distribution
LASFS Meeting Number 1941
October 24, 1974

The first mention of Dungeons & Dragons

Published as PDF in 2016

200183.name: Homeland for All
200183.description:
From publisher blurb:

After barely repulsing the disastrous raid on Musklageta, the Knight Protectors have formalized a policy confining their activity to the immediate vicinity of Musklageta. Recognizing there will be matters that may require intervention beyond the town to ensure the safety of the threats they secure, the Knight Protectors empower a small group of Marshals to deal with such issues. How will the marshals respond to their first test? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 11th level characters. Episode 4 in the The Legends of Musklageta.

200184.name: Monopoly: Super Mario Bros
200184.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Super Mario Bros of Monopoly allows players to buy, sell and trade locations from the eight worlds featured in the classic 8-bit version of the 1985 video game. Custom 8-bit styled game pieces complete this 8-bit classic styled Monopoly game with an original Super Mario Bros twist.

200187.name: Kaiju Beastiary: Kamon the Living Mountain
200187.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ground shakes as a booming footstep echoes across the mountain range. A roar sends birds into flight, and deafens those too close for comfort. A mountain, no, a living mountain, plods across the land, leaving a wake of destruction in its path. Worst that that? Those horrible creatures that swarmed the village as the beast walked pass.

Kaiju Bestiary: Kamon the Living Mountain focuses on one such force of nature. Inside you will find:

Kaiju stats for Kamon
An acquired template
A community built INSIDE the beast
Ultimate Campaign army stats




And more!

200188.name: Monster Misfits
200188.description:
Description from the publisher:

Monster Misfitsis a ridiculous card game where dancing, hairy, buttface monsters battle in four different realms.

It combines casual game play with strategic elements and (un)lovable monsters.

Play it on its own, or combine it with another Monster game deck for up to 10 players.

How to Play
Each Player is dealt 8 cards. At the beginning of your turn, you may play a Chaos Card, and follow its instructions. Even if you have played a Chaos Card, you must always play a Realm Card on the pile. You can either play Realm Cards of matching value, or Realm Cards of higher value in the same realm. First player to get rid of all their cards, wins!

200189.name: Avalon Haunts 01
200189.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for you game; well Avalon is here with Avalon Haunts. Each issue brings you a unique, fun and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt, you will find them easy to use, fun to play and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have Frigid Treasures of Moosehold.

200190.name: Study Hall Skirmish
200190.description:
It’s the last hour of the school day, on a Friday, before a vacation, and there’s a substitute teacher in study hall. Of course a spitball fight breaks out … Players will buy classroom combat troops, set them up on the study hall battle grid, and wage furious pencil driven warfare!

Players take turns spending 12 troop points, buying and placing a single troop each turn. Troops are represented by unique symbols, cost the number of squares they cover, and each have an action as detailed in the troop chart. Troops can never move once they are placed.

Once all 12 points of troops have been placed, players will take turns using the actions of all of their available troops. Some troops are only available on some rounds, and destroyed troops can never take an action. The start player is whoever was most recently in detention. Rounds are tracked on the round chart with each player drawing half of an X in the current round box after they have acted, making a full X after both sides have gone.

To use an action, place your pencil tip on the acting troop, close your eyes, and draw a line - an action line – toward another troop. An action is successful if the action line touches another troop, affecting the first troop it touches (unless the troop’s description says differently). An action line doesn’t have to be ruler straight, but it must travel in what is generally a straight line. You can’t scribble or go all ziggy-zaggy.

When a troop is damaged, shade in one of its squares. It doesn’t matter which square gets shaded. Repairs work the same way, but you erase the damage from the affected troop. When a troop has all it’s squares shaded in, it is destroyed. If a troop has been destroyed it can still be repaired.

The first player to destroy all their opponent’s troops wins! If no one has won by the 24th round, whoever has taken the least damage wins.

200191.name: Link
200191.description:
Link is a strategy game with roguelike elements.

Take control over group of soldiers trying to survive on the hostile, arctic planet.

Can you survive until someone will come for rescue?

Source: The Developer Website.

200192.name: A-Gents
200192.description:
A-Gents is the squad of highly trained operatives and bounty hunters. Join Sean and Emma in this dynamic, non-stop-action game. Storm the compounds of contraband dealers and smugglers around the globe, and collect goodies.

Source: The Developer Website.

200193.name: Contrapposto
200193.description:
From DriveThruRPG item description:

Contrapposto is a storytelling game about planning an art heist, designed to be played discreetly in an actual art museum.

3-5 players take on the roles of a team of amateur thieves hired to obtain a work of art. All players work together to identify which piece of art they’re after and plan how to steal it while balancing the team’s odd assortment of skills & hangups.

In about an hour and a half, the team will case the joint, plan their caper & try to convince each other that this will work.

And if the group can tolerate each other long enough to complete their scheme, it just might!

Contrapposto is part improv comedy and part exercise in teamwork, with a healthy respect for art & museums thrown in. Don't worry: no actual laws should be broken while playing! It's largely a fun way to visit an art museum with a group of friends.

The phases of the game are:

Introductions - We’ll draw cards that assign us aspects our characters. Then we'll go around the circle, introducing ourselves in character.

Casing the Joint - We’ll draw one shared card describing the work of art we’re meant to steal. Then we’ll move through the museum, debating which piece that card refers to.

Planning - We’ll come up with a nice, logical, easy-does-it, can’t-go-wrong plan to steal the art.

Rehearsal - When it comes to executing a heist smoothly, you can’t just wing it. We’ll need to discretely rehearse the plan without rousing any suspicion.

You in? - After the rehearsal, we’ll have a chance to vote out any Rats in the crew and try to convince each other that this will work

Aftermath - We’ll all play a Followthrough card to show what we do on the day of the heist. If we haven’t been betrayed, we’ll tally up our scores to see if we got away with it!

200194.name: Nordguard: Tribes of the White Land
200194.description:
Nordguard: Tribes of the White Land contains 36 cards (including 2 new canon Nordguard characters from the graphic novels).

An expansion to Nordguard: The Card Game, this pack not only allows for additional players, but balances out the impact of larger teams.

200195.name: Slave Trade
200195.description:
From the introduction:

The life of a yeoman farmer is fraught with danger. But a disaster for a yeoman farmer is an opportunity for adventure. Will heroes emerge to rescue the farmer Tarman’s family from raiders?

User summary:

An adventure for 2nd level characters

200196.name: The Quarrymen
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
200196.description:
From the introduction:

For years there have been legends of a lost ancient complex hidden deep within the town quarry, and it seems that the local quarrymen have now stumbled upon an entrance to it. Long thought lost to the ages, little about it is known for sure, although rumours are now flying through the town.

Sixty-six quarrymen took the opportunity to enter the complex opening and take a look around, but they have all since disappeared. Only Henry the Quarry master made back to the entrance, but he is not a well man. Found limp, semiconscious, and raving at the entrance to the complex by the two Foremen who remained behind, he can only babble about "The Creature," squid, jars, jars, endless jars. Any questioning about the contents of the jars causes him to go into fits and screams.

200197.name: Buddy Movie
200197.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game attempts to emulate a certain type of movie featuring two friends having various mishaps. The intent is to provide a simple, humorous roleplaying experience for two players. The mechanics are free-form and although the game does use a dice, it could probably be dispensed with easily enough.

200198.name: Election
200198.description:
This U.S. election game is played with two decks of cards. The Rollcall deck, backed with stars on blue, contains a card for each state, showing an outline of the state, the cost of campaigning for the state, the number of electoral votes it provides, and one of eight symbols representing different power blocs. The Campaign Deck, with red and white striped backs, consists of five types of cards used to capture states: Campaign contributions (money), Splinter Party, Favorite Sun, Endorsement and Party in Power.

The state card deck is shuffled, and the first six states are laid on the table. Each player receives a hand of seven Campaign cards. On each turn, he uses his hand to take states either from the table or from other players. Once he has made as many moves as he desires and can afford, he ends his turn by drawing two more Campaign cards from the deck.

States on the table can be obtained by discarding campaign contributions greater than or equal to the campaign cost of the state. No change is provided. States can be taken from other players by using the other cards. Using Endorsement, a player must pay 1.5 times the normal cost to take a state from another player; using Favorite Son, he pays only the normal cost; and using Splinter Party, he pays only half the normal cost. The most powerful card is the Party in Power, which allows the taking of one state from each opponent for half their normal costs - but the player must take and pay for a state from each player.

The final element to strategy is the assembly of power blocs. When a player manages to assemble three or more states with the same symbol, he pays $1M per state and places them in front of him as a group. After that, only the top card is vulnerable to attack, and the attacker must pay double the normal cost.

Once the last state has been taken, electoral college votes are tallied and the player with the most votes wins.

200199.name: Thomas The Tank Engine & Friends (Computer)
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
200199.description:
From the inlay:

It's full steam ahead once again for Thomas, he's had a busy week at the Station and now it looks likely this week is going to be just as busy. The Fat Controller's head is spinning with all the special trips he has to organise. It is a good job that he has Thomas and his friends to rely upon. He calls Thomas over.

"Now Thomas," he says, "I have selected some very important jobs for you to do this week. I know that you will do your best and that you will be very careful."

"Oh yes, sir", says Thomas, "You know you can trust me, I want to be a really useful engine."

"These are the jobs you must do." the Fat Controller replies, "Take the children to the seaside, take a tractor over to the station by the broken bridge, take some medicine to the hospital, deliver some logs to the sawmill and coal to the power station, deliver the mail and finally take some oil over to the refinery. Now there is a lot to do so do not waste time. You can do the jobs in any order but each one must be finished before the sun goes down."

"All right sir, I had better get started." says Thomas as he hurries over to the turn table.

200200.description:
From the publisher:

This mini-expansion features:

3 New Ship Models (Available as STL files)
3 New Ship Ability Cards (Available as PDFs or PNGs)
3 New Ship Mats (Available as PDFs)
200200.name: Xia: Print and Play Mini Expansion

200201.name: Fanorona Dimy
200201.description:
Played by the same rules as Fanorona but on a 5x5 grid of an Alquerque board instead of the 5x9 grid used by
Fanorona. On this smaller board Fanorona Dimy is played with 12 black pieces and 12 white pieces.

Capturing is compulsory and a series of captures may be made by the same piece on a turn, as in checkers. Unique aspects of the game include its method of capture (either approaching or withdrawing your piece from a line of enemy pieces), and the "vela partie" (debt game) after winning a decisive game (the winner must let the loser "eat" one man each turn for 9 consecutive moves). Because of the density of the board (only one open spot at the games beginning) and the unique method of capture, strategy is complex and enigmatic, with fewer pieces often beating more pieces.

200202.name: Schmovie: Table Top Day 2016 Felicia and Wil Schquid Trophies
200202.description: This is a set of two schquid trophies featuring Felicia Day and Wil Wheaton. These promos were released for Table Top Day 2016.

200204.name: Come One, Come All
200204.description:
User summary:

This intriguing game presents a very idiosyncratic and humorous setting full of preposterous customs that are taken over-seriously by those involved in them (and not-at-all-seriously by the players). The game itself is very free-form, with two action tables (flow charts) demonstrating narrative structure. The bulk of the game document establishes the peculiar setting.

200205.name: Midnight at Burning Horse
200205.description:
User summary:

Characters have Traits generated by random roll against a table. Each Trait has a Sign, Symbol, Meaning, and Value - and also indicates demographic features. The Value in turn is used to consult an entry in the I Ching which further defines the character. During play, simple dice pools are used to generate additional random results ("hexagrams"). The game is intended to remain faithful to the historical basis of the Japanese-American Internment during the early 1940s in the USA.

200206.name: Mars-Odyssee 2010
200206.description:
2-4 players race to the red planet of Mars. This game comes packaged in a deluxe wooden crate. Most game materials are wooden, along with some hand silk-screened cards. Each player has a rocket with several wooden parts, including a capsule, fuel stages, tail section, and drive.

In a twist, the playing area is vertical. Three long poles for the trajectory to Mars, which is a red sphere placed at the top. Play cards to blast off from the launch pad, and race to Mars. But you must contend with your fellow voyagers, asteroids, meteorites, and even a black hole.

200207.description: The Booster Deck brings your copy of Exotic Predators Limited Edition up to par to match the same number of Affliction and Evolve cards for the new Base Game Set found in Second Edition as well as Alpha cards and few revised cards.
boardgameaccessory: Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game: Exotic Predators
200207.name: Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game: Exotic Predators Booster Deck Cardpack

200209.name: Rhyminitions
200209.description: Rhyminitions is a party game. Players get questions about words that sound alike such as "Rabbit" and "Habit". If the player can correct can identify the answer the player gets one point. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

200210.name: Are You Ready For The 4th Grade?
200210.description: Are You Ready For The 4th Grade? is a educational children's game. The players gets questions about math and language, and also gets "challenges". There is three levels of difficulty, giving the player $50, $100 or $200 in-game money. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

200211.name: Warzone (1986)
200211.description:
Game box
Welcome to Warzone, a smooth scrolling, all action arcade type game that uses the full color graphic capabilities of your machine to the fullest. The downward scrolling takes your tank through many different cities and landscapes. How far can you progress through without being blown apart? Will you be able to reach your final objective?

Program and Music - Janko Mrsic-Flogel
Graphic Design and Arrangement - Mungo Amyatt

200212.name: War Zone
200212.description:
Game box

The year is 1999. World peace is being threatened by an unknown enemy force. You and your accomplice have been chosen to lead an allied attack which will take you through eight different scenarios.

War Zone can be played by two players simultaneoulsly or as a single player game. The two player game centres around the inter action between both players developing a need for team work and 'cover my back' style of strategy.

200213.name: The Fighting Man! A Required Rebuild for the Fighter
200213.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fighters Can Have Nice Things Too!

Fighters are a mainstay in fantasy fiction and have thus far have got the short end of the stick in terms of optimization in the metagame. They have a distinct lack of competitive options, have rather static progression, and later publications have done a better job representing the fighter (mechanically) via archetypes and hybrids the the base class itself does.

Thus we present the fighting man! An easy to understand, easy to use, more mechanically vibrant and optimization friendly rebuild of the fighter class that helps re-establish it as a competitively viable martial character. Select from 40+ new fighting man talents, rearrange them on the fly to suit any situation, dominate the battlefield control with a mastery of combat maneuvers, and SO much more!

Included:

The fighting man rebuild of the fighter
42 fighting man talents
The magic knight fighting man archetype
The heavy blader fighting man archetype
4 new combat feats!

200214.name: Vindicators: First Class
200214.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Vindicators

Donovan Shepherd created a safe place, and school, for meta-youngsters. Many of them go on to be a part of the Vindicators, an emergency-response field team. Here is the first graduating class:

Animal (PL 9): Agile and quick, fur-covered and fanged.
Flamingo (PL 9): High-flying, winged, and very, very fast.
Permafrost (PL 9): Controls ice and cold. Ultimate in pranks!
Spitfire (PL 9): Sizzling eye-beams controlled by a high-tech visor.
White Rose (PL 9): Powerful psychic with a dark potential.

200215.name: Mythic Kingdoms
200215.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rules for settlements and PC constructed kingdoms appear in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: GameMastery Guide and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Campaign. These provide all the information required for the construction of most normal communities, from discrete little thorps to complex thriving nations. However, there is a distinct lack of the wondrous and fantastical within. The rules fall short when posed with the challenge of fashioning technomagical civilizations stuck out of time, necromancy-saturated cities built on undead labor, or extraplanar nations united by mysterious magical gates.

Naturally, it seems that the founding of such should be beyond the reach of mere mortals, but the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures book allows PCs to achieve greater reaches of power. Likewise, the GM may simply wish to establish a campaign visiting or based within a location touched by mythic influences. Four Horsemen Present Mythic Kingdoms attempts to provide GMs and players with the tools necessary to build castles in the sky or reclaim a lost legendary realm steeped in destiny.

200216.name: Blood and Gold: From the Ashes - Character Race: Lizardfolk
200216.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood and Gold: From the Ashes - Character Race: Lizardfolk is an introduction to the Lizardfolk of a new campaign setting, Blood and Gold: From the Ashes. It introduces an entirely new player race, Lizardfolk, usable with any setting of Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition. It also features story information for the Lizardfolk and their history in the Newborn World, a setting wracked by an apocalypse in the distant past and rising from the ashes yet again.

200217.name: Microprose Golf
200217.description:
User Summary
Golf simulator with a deep insigt

200218.name: Ale Historia!
200218.description: It's quiz game for whole family about history of Poland since first Prince Mieszko the first till modern times.

200219.name: Critical Feats
200219.description:
From publisher blurb:

Critical hits can be useful in combat, the extra burst of damage they give can mean the difference between life and death, in winning the combat against the beast or losing your own head to its mighty maw.
But, for some people, it can be boring just doing simple damage, even though it can be quite a high amount of damage. Critical Feats sets out to address this, by providing a system for altering and providing more variety for your confirmed crits.

You can store criticals for later use, use them in new ways, gain an advantage when you almost get a critical hit or even replace it the damaging effect with something else that can aid in combat.

Featuring -

10 feats that can manipulate your critical hits or other similar effects such as blocking damage from another critical hit or storing one for later use
A feat for when you get Near-Critical hits
10 feats for replacing what happens you get a critical hit, such as a bonus to your armour, a chance to flee unhindered and more

200220.name: Killer of Pirates
200220.description: Killer of Pirates is a game based on the game Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha), and shares many rules with BANG! The players play cards to try to eliminate the other players, and win if only players of their own team is still in play. The game has the theme of One Piece.

200221.name: Ashford (Sytem Neutral Edition)
200221.description:
From publisher blurb:

A System Neutral Edition GM’s Resource supplement by Creighton Broadhurst

Once a prosperous village, Ashford now stands as a decayed shadow of its former self. A year ago, it was a busy place; its streets and gardens echoing with the sounds of life, love and commerce. Then the stranger came and death followed upon his heels. Plague had come to Ashford. In his wake, he left the hacking coughs and pain-filled moans of the dying and the wails of the survivors mourning their dead. Over half the population died, and many of the survivors packed and fled.

A few folk yet dwell in Ashford among the abandoned, deserted homes of their friends and neighbours but it is now a quiet, mournful place. Weeds choke its abandoned gardens and untilled fields. Wolves, foxes and other less natural predators gnaw at the weathered bones filling the village’s open plague pit. The surviving villagers are distrustful of strangers, shunning them whenever possible, and few find welcome, cheer or solace in Ashford.

200222.name: Penitent's Rest
200222.description:
From publisher blurb:

Far from civilisation, the Shrine of Alikandara Lat—better known as Penitent’s Rest—draws the wicked and woeful from all over the world. Founded in memory of a fallen paladin, the one-time hero of her age, the shrine is a refuge for those in search of atonement for their misdeeds. The caretakers, having overcome their own sordid pasts, now watch over an ever-changing group of pilgrims who make their way to Alikandara Lat’s cenotaph. Many hope the ghost of the ex-paladin will make an appearance to help them expurgate their sins. Others, though, have less genuine reasons for their journeys…and the fiend who centuries ago seduced the paladin into evil isn’t necessarily done with her.

200223.name: Clever Combat Feats
200223.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clever Combat Feats is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the subtle arts of intrigue, from spies and saboteurs to heists, chases, mysteries, secret identities, and the fine art of conversation. If your character's cutting wit is as swift as her flashing blade, and if she relies on speed, skill, and subtlety over strength, she will love exploring the possibilities of 9 new mythic feats from Cat and Mouse and Fencing Grace to Ready for Anything and Clambering Escape!

200224.name: Killer of Tokyo Ghoul
200224.description: Killer of Tokyo Ghoul is a game based on the game Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha), and shares many rules with BANG! The players play cards to try to eliminate the other players, and win if only players of their own team are still in play. The game has the theme of the Tokyo Ghoul anime.

200225.name: Championship Golf
200225.description:
Game box
You are there. The 18th tee at Pebble Beach, You look out over one of the most spectacular and challenginng pieces of golf real estate in the world. Your decisions and skill will mean the difference between an elecrifying birdie or a humbling bogey.
Hole agter hole, shot fter shot, Championship Golf challenges you to play the same 18 holes tjat tje pros consider to be some of the most beautiful and toughest in the world. All 18 holes are completly and authentically recreated. You'll even have to compensate for the wind off the ocean.
You control all aspectd of your game. Carry a bag of 14 clubs. Determaine which club o use, foot positioning, wrist and body action, and type of swing. You can warm up on the driving range or the putting green..
Whatever your handicap, Championship Golf gives you the chance to play one of the world's great courses - all for less than the cost of a round at Pebble Beach.
Tee it up!

200227.name: GeeBee Air Rally
200227.description:
Game box

GeeBee Air Rally - joystick-gripping, pylon-shaving racing action.
Speed in spades. Trick turns. A swarm of other panes to outfly and outmaneuver - or collide with.
All in three dimensions. Because in GeeBee Air Rally you race not just next to or around the competitionm but over and under them as well.
With 16 unique and challenging courses, including four special slalom and balloon-popping events, 256 levels of difficulty, so the challenge never ends. And authentic sights, sounds and music that recall the days when speed kings were the heroes of the skies.
GeeBee Air Rally. Strap yourself in, grab your joystick and open the throttle. You are in for a whale of a ride.

200228.name: Wicked
200228.description:
Game box

The Universe is alive, held together ny the power of good. But evil has penetrated the twelve great constellations throught portals of destructions. It is spreading fast, fighting for domination, groving ever sttronger.
You are called upon, a mere mortal, to purge the Universe of evil in service of the Sun God.
Learn to hate the forces of evil. Defeat it!
Discover it's many guises, it's strengths and its weaknesses; sporing, settling, spreading - it's silent, it's cunning and it's... WICKED!

200229.name: Feats of Vision
200229.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Ferocity features nine new feats for oracles and other divinatory spellcasters: Diviner's Ward, Master's Eyes, Master's Voice, Oracular Armor, Oracular Boon, Oracular Omen, Oracular Portents, Mad Impulse, and Read Lips.

200230.name: Power Hits
200230.description:
User Summary

A package of 10 games, published in a package by Activision. This is one of the "classic compilations".

200231.name: The Soulless Heart (Antipaladin/Fighter Hybrid)
200231.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fight against good is a tiring but satisfying business. While some are called by the dark to be drive forth the spread of evil, many other competent soldiers fill the gap to take up arms against those that commit the most honorable of acts. The soulless heart combines the martial focus of the fighter with many of the profanely vested gifts of the anti-paladin to aid in their never-ending quest to overcome the light. This supplement also includes new feats geared for the soulless heart's special abilities.

200232.name: The Price of Rebirth: Expanded Injury, Resurrection, and Lichdom Rules
200232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Death lies in wait for the hapless adventurer in the dark corners of the dungeon, amidst the gnarled trees of the forest, and even in the halls of mighty kings. Even the strongest adventurer faces a constant threat of death, as the adventuring profession is not for the timid.

However, not all heroes and villains die so quickly, even in the absence of powerful magic capable of raising or resurrecting the dead. Instead, this supplement proposes a possibility for first aid – or even ordinary healing magic – to bring back a character from the brink of death if applied in a timely fashion. But such lucky escape from the maws of hell is not without consequences.

The supplement includes:

Critical injury and treating it - and lasting injury
Variant Raise Dead rules with circumstances, from mild to dire
Variant and less predictable Reincarnation rules
Become a LICH!

200233.name: Children of the Restless Earth
200233.description:
From publisher blurb:

The spread of the Demon Lord’s shadow has triggered calamities and catastrophes that have upset the natural order of things, such that havens have become tombs, cities awash with blood, and monsters loosed in the countryside. No longer can people huddle in the dark; the time for hiding has come to an end, for the Demon Lord will devour all as it destroys the world. So, as the salamanders have begun to descend from their fiery peaks, so have the gnomes been dislodged from their cavernous homes to emerge blinking into the world they abandoned long ago.

This supplement reveals the gnomes, the second of the elemental ancestries for play in Shadow of the Demon Lord.

200234.name: Raid on Fort Douaumont
rpgpodcastepisode: CVGAP #25 - The Weird War I One Shot
200234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raid on Fort Douaumont is an exciting mix of action, warfare, and horror by Eddy Webb and the mysterious Teller.

Your heroes are French infantrymen who meet Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, battle ancient evils, and lead their section into the blasted remains of Fort Douaumont itself! It’s a creepy tale of wartime horror that should challenge even the most gallant soldier.

200235.name: Mulch Stalker
200235.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Mulch Stalker CR 3
2 New Magic Items: Frog’s Eye Ioun Stone, Manticore Tail Flail
7 New Natural Items: Froghemoth Eye, Hydra Blood, Intellect Devourer Jerky, Manticore Tail, Medusa’s Head, Mulch Rot Powder, Rust Monster Antennae

200236.name: Doom of the Sky Sword (5E)
200236.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Harbinger of Doom Descends From The Sky

Following the disappearance of personnel at a lumber camp, a mysterious sword drops from the sky, cleaving the very earth to deliver a pronouncement of doom upon all who refuse to leave the logging site. Can the adventurers ferret out the source of this ominous portent and put a stop to it before it wreaks further havoc on the loggers?

Doom of the Sky Sword is an exciting adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves series, and is compatible with the best-selling Fifth Edition of the World's Oldest Fantasy Roleplaying Game. This adventure is designed to challenge four to five 1st-level PCs like no other content has to date. Inside this volume, you’ll find:

Two monsters and new encounters for your campaign
A full-color map of the abandoned hideout of a trio of troll witches
Enough content to get your group of 1st-level PCs through a night of play with little preparation time required




Dangers Unknown. Treasures Untold. Adventure Awaits.

200237.name: The Grey Man of Chapel Weir
200237.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Town of Tunere' has been blessed with fertile lands and abundant crops. It has grown from a small village to an incredible city. However, it has a dark history. Every year a youth is sacrificed to maintain this prosperity, but now the Grey Man is coming much more often to claim the tributes.

The mayor and businessmen are desperate to find a solution. Can the heroes stop the sacrifices or will doing so destroy the world? Why is the Grey Man coming more often? Has some other dark force altered the delicate balance?

Tangent! products have a detailed location, complete with a map, NPCs, and plot hooks to get the players involved. Each Tangent! is system-less, allowing you to modify it for your game and play style. They have enough content ideas for at least one night of game play.

200238.name: Dark Soul Source Book
200238.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darkness. The absence of light. Mankind has feared it since the beginning of time. That is because on some level we have always known it has always been there, ready to devour anything that crosses its path. Creating monsters out of men, feeding on our despair. Cyclical, eternal and undeniable. This is the Dark Soul, a supplement for the Mutant Chronicles roleplaying game.

Features 248 pages of Dark Legion secrets:

The Apostles: How do they interact and what are the Apostles truly? Discover their internal rivalry and their ancient hierarchy.
Legions: Each Apostle has its own legions, even its own Malignants. Learn of them all and what purpose they serve and the powers they wield.
Heretics: Do they all commit evil acts just for the sake of it or are there still twisted human emotions governing them? Learn what it is to become a heretic and what drives them.
Powers: Each Apostle bestows its worshippers with unique powers. Study them in depth, and the price that comes by wielding them. All Heretics can be struck by the dreaded stigmata and degeneration.
Technology: The Dark Technology, over which Algeroth rules, is the hammer swung by the Apostles, crushing all hope from mankind. Discover intricate new weapons, equipment and the corruption they bring.

200239.name: Meld
200239.description:
Meld is a mind-bending puzzle game featuring hundreds of levels and a build-in editor so you can create your own and play levels made by others! Master dozens of powerups and layers of strategy to make your way through each level. Meld features a build-in tutorial system which makes learning the rules and strategy simple!

Source: The Game Website.

200240.name: Atomas
200240.description:
User Summary

Atomas is a mobile single-player game in which the player increases their score by fusing atoms together. The atoms are placed in a circle on the screen. New atoms appear in the middle of the circle, and the player can choose where to place them. Sometimes special bonding atoms appear, which the player can use to fuse equal atoms together to form higher-order atoms. The game starts with atoms with low numbers, such as Hydrogen (1), Helium (2) and Lithium (3), but while playing, the numbers of the generated atoms increase (looping back to Hydrogen after 125).

Different playing modes are available, including a timed-attack mode (in which the player has only limited time to make a decision) and a Zen mode (in which the range between atom numbers is much smaller than for the classic mode, so the game is a lot easier).

200241.name: 200 Word RPG Challenge 2016 Collection
rpg: Is the Space Pope a Lizard?
Nos Morituri: We who are about to die
Out Of The Crucible, A Fire
200241.description:
Editor summary
The 200 Word RPG Contest didn’t start out as a contest, but simply as a fun exercise to force me to finish a game I was working on at the time. However, a lot of people picked up on it, and jumped right in. Soon, I had over 150 submissions! It was so incredible to see the amazing games that people came up with. I highly encourage you to read as many as you can, winners or no. The original prompt for the contest was:

“Design a Tabletop RPG, Setting, Hack, Expansion, or whatever in 200 words or less.”

rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
200242.name: Exodus
200242.description:
User summary:

This unique game features a very well-developed setting with a great deal of internal consistency. Too, it features unusually high production qualities. The game successfully balances setting development with game mechanics, drawing on a variety of sources including the Biblical Exodus; most of the game document is focused on the history and plight of a remnant of humanity fleeing attack by taking to space.

200244.name: Have You Seen the Yellow Sign?
rpg: Have You Seen the Yellow Sign?
200244.description:
From the introduction:

La Vista Shopping Mall is a nightmarish paradise. Its shining walkways and elevators surround a dark central lake. Through gleaming windows, you glimpse impossible luxury and beautiful, happy people.

Yet nothing here seems natural. The geometries seem wrong: how can this size 10 dress fit you, when you haven’t been to the gym in weeks? The mathematics seem strange: how can they sell three pairs of shoes for twenty dollars?

And, in every store, you see The Yellow Sign. Shaped like a starfish, with a central smiling face, it dances in the periphery of your vision. It signifies something of immense portent: the best quality, for the best prices, for one weekend only!

Now, that is worth investigating.

User summary:

The game does not require a game master, but can be played differently by utilizing one (the rules offer this option). The game uses d6 pools of specific colors; if those colors are not available others could be substituted (but color is significant).

200245.name: The Hangover
200245.description:
User summary:

The game uses hands of poker to establish narrative priority during each scene (there are six structured scenes). Narrative influence is gained by spending poker chips from an established kitty. There is no game master, though one player assumes the unique role of James Bond; other players assume secondary roles. The game primarily resolves through narrative contribution of the various players.

The Alpha Draft version was submitted to the Little Game Chef 2010 competition. A lightly revised and cleaned-up version was published in HTML a few years later.

200246.name: Valence (2010)
200246.description:
From the introduction:

Carbon atoms like you rarely recreate, at least not here in reality. While your mind keeps your attention focused in the shifting distractions of the Design, your atomic body takes well-deserved holiday gliding in the troposhpere. You managed to shack up with two sexy oyxgen molecules, digging their vibrations for the last few days. But now, one of them is getting annoying and the other is losing interest. Fortunately, there is a storm coming. That should shake things up...

Humans may think that atoms drift aimlessly, one random interaction at a time, but you know better. The atoms call the dream-like realm of imagination where they really spend their time the Design, not that there is much order to it. Still, any time atoms hook up in the real world, its only because something happened in the Design to make it so. But even the fluctuating chaos of the Design develops something of a status quo. At least until the lightning hits...

User summary:

Play requires three packs of standard playing cards and a molecular modeling kit (e.g., Molymod Kit, etc.) - extemporized objects can be used.

Two versions of the game were published nearly simultaneously - one for the Game Chef submission and one for general use. The sole difference involves an additional page noting licensing information.

200247.name: Austerlitz 1805: Rising Eagles
200247.description:
Rising Eagles is to be the the second volume of the « Eagles » series. Following on from Fallen Eagles (The Battle of Waterloo), Rising Eagles covers another of history’s most famous battles - Austerlitz.

Game scale is regiment level for units, 250m per hex and one hour of real time per turn. The map has been produced by the combined efforts of Rick Barber (topography) and Sebastien Brunel (graphics, as in Fallen Eagles).
The game will include at least three short scenarios, together with a full battle scenario, offering alternative options to simulate the ‘fog of war’ and battle plans.

The order rules In Rising Eagles will have an even greater impact than those in Fallen Eagles. The ability to change orders will be reduced and it will be more difficult to “recall” formations, once launched. Initial planning will be an important feature, as befits a Napoleonic battle of such a scale.

In addition, ‘fog of war’ has been further developed and will be part of the main rules. Players will share some of the uncertainty experienced by the actual commanders, as to what precisely they are facing.

Initial play tests have shown that Rising Eagles continues to provide a tense and exciting game play, with strategic battle planning assuming a greater significance than the ‘slogging match’ of Waterloo.

200248.name: The Troll Pits of Hextor (5e)
200248.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure takes place in the Kingdom of Zeland. Zeland, an old member of the now-defunct Eastern Alliance, is ancient Irish in flavor.
