They both have magnificent beards. Another exciting RPG adventure story in Trollworld written by Ken St Andre, creator of Tunnel & Trolls, the 2nd oldest Role-Playing Game in history.

200369.name: APA-L (Issue 507 - Jan 1975)
200369.description:
APA-L
507th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1955
January 30, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200370.description:
A ruthless struggle for power in a small Spanish village. Accusations will fly as knives, impossible projects will come true and the sickening stench of corruption will be clearly noticed. The meanest face of politics in a card game for three to six players. A self-published free print and play game.

The goal of this game is prevail in the struggle for power in a small village. The winner will be the one who win the mayoralty in two elections.

The village is represented by seven scene's cards, different in every match. They represent activities and places that give votes to players. Sometimes, they will have the chance of change them by their own projects for strenghten their own voting base and weaken his opponents at the same time. When it happens, players must negotiate which of the scene cards will be substituted by the new project. If necessary, they vote if each project is accepted or rejected.

Players take cards of a deck and use them by turns for attacking, defend themselves and take new votes and cards. If they obtain the Opportunity card they will have the chance to execute one of their projects. If they have (and decide to use) the Temptation card, they will choose one of the corruption cards, which purpose is to buy votes or councilors.

After the third round, it's time to elections. Players count their votes and assign to each one the members of the town hall. If a player is elected for second time, wins the match.
200370.name: Monicipio, todo por el Poder

200371.description:
Match magic symbols to summon elder gods, demons, and mythological monsters, then use them to attack your opponents.

You start with two decks of cards: SPELLS and SUMMONS. Spell cards each have 4-6 different magic symbols on them. Each player starts with 2 Spell cards and then draws 1 new card every turn. You can never have more than 6 Spell cards in your hand at once though. The goal is to pair up matching symbols across your Spell cards to create hands, sort of like a weird, alternate universe version of poker. Once you've matched up a complete Spell hand, you trade it in to draw Summon cards. How many Summon cards you can draw in a turn depends on the complexity of the hand you trade in for it.Summon cards depict a deity, demon, or monster from a variety of mythological, religious, literary, or just plain made-up sources. Each Summon card has an ability that you can play against your competitors to make them lose turns, discard spell cards, or other nefarious setbacks. Each and every Summon card you play puts you one step closer to victory, until...

For a 30-45 minute game, the first person to play 7 Summon cards wins! Want a longer game? Really challenge yourself and play to 13 Summon cards. That's the basics. Pretty simple, huh? Oh, one little twist I forgot to mention...

Included in the Summon deck are the 4 Horsemen of the Apocalypse. They're extremely powerful cards by themselves, but if by some unholy fluke you manage to draw and play all four of them in a game, you win instantly, no matter how many other Summon cards you've played.

And... shuffled into the Spell card deck are also Curse cards, which can totally throw off even the best player's strategy. They can make YOU lose turns, give other players cards, or other setbacks, so watch out! The tables can turn at any time and nobody is ever safe for long.
200371.name: NecronomiCards

200372.name: Rope Rescue
200372.description:
Rope Rescue is an award-winning top-10 iOS puzzler where the player guides Rupert the Parrot to wrap the rope around the wheels and free the baby birds. Drag a length of rope through a series of gears, and attach it to the cage to release your friends. Pesky enemies, fire, and other rope-wrecking obstacles threaten feathered freedom. Collect butterflies on the way for special bonuses, and try use as little rope as possible for maximum points.

Source: The Developer Website.

200373.name: APA-L (Issue 508 - Feb 1975)
200373.description:
APA-L
508th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1956
February 6, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200374.name: Fleeting Ages
200374.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Fleeting Ages features a never seen gameplay element in other sandbox games which will ensure the feeling of being an important figure of the game world. You can make permanent changes in the world of Fleeting Ages which will affect every aspect of the game. Experience the different ages from the prehistoric era to the Industrial era on the same map and observe as they transition into each other.

Shape the world around you and observe how it will affect the hostile enemies and their behavior, the weapons they use, the houses they build and the clothes they are wearing in the different ages that you triggered to shift.

Source: The Developer Website.

200375.name: Pulp Cthulhu
200375.description:
From the back cover:

Calling All Heroes! It’s Time To Take the Fight to Cthulhu!

Pulp Cthulhu is a game of two-fisted adventure, weird science, dark deeds, and brave heroes. With this book, some roleplaying dice, and the Call of Cthulhu Rulebook, you have everything you need to adventure and explore games set in the pulp genre.

Tired of your investigators dying in quick succession when jaunting around the world in a desperate bid to save humanity? Wishing that sometimes your investigator could make a stand instead of hiding and waiting for the eldritch horror to pass? Pulp Cthulhu ups the ante and provides you with tougher, more capable heroes—ready to take on the villainous machinations of the Cthulhu Mythos!

Here you will find an adapted character generation system, rules for psychic powers, sanity, augmented skills, and weird science, as well as tips for Keepers on developing and running pulp-style games. Also, you will find information on “the Pulps” themselves and the 1930s era, when America was in the grip of the Great Depression and on the road to World War II. A collection of pulp villains and monsters, and a range of pulp organizations provide the Keeper with a firm basis for running pulp style scenarios and campaigns. Four action-packed scenarios round out the book, getting your Pulp Cthulhu games started with a bang.

The guidance in this book means that you can apply the Pulp Cthulhu rules to any setting and time period, enabling Keepers to bring the flavor and action of pulp to the classic 1920s or modern-day eras, as well as anywhere they see fit.

A Time For Heroes And A Time For Adventure!

200376.name: APA-L (Issue 509 - Feb 1975)
200376.description:
APA-L
509th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1957
February 13, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200377.name: Game of Funny Conversation Cards
200377.description:
While this 1906 question-and-answer game from Milton Bradley might seem to be a response to Parker Brothers' 1893 Komikal Konversation Kards, it actually owes more to the much earlier 1784 Comic Conversation Cards (unknown publisher).

While the former provided questions and answers to be distributed randomly amongst a mixed group, the 18th century game specified that answers must be given by someone of the opposite sex from the questioner. Comic Conversation Cards is even more specific: the Gentleman asks the questions and the Lady provides the answers.

There are 24 Question cards in black and 24 Answer cards in red. Here is one example. One question: "Has mamma bought you a rubber dollie yet?" One answer: "I'll ask mamma, and let you know next Sunday afternoon". A bit forward for a first date, wot?

200378.name: Japhet Jenkins' and Sally Jones' Visit Tu Bosting
200378.description:
The rules say the full title of this 1868 game from Milton Bradley is: "A Side-splitting Account of Japhet Jenkins' and Sally Jones' Visit Tu Bosting with the Old Meere and a Load Uv Pro-Duce", subtitled "A facetious fund of funny fancies from fact and fiction".

One part of the game consists of a booklet with title page, publishing information and preface, followed by a 20-page story told in a kind of country-bumpkin dialect and containing many blanks. The other part of the game is made up of 162 small (2.5" x 1/2") cards each printed with a noun and one or more other words (e.g. "A rusty rasher of bacon" or "A fighting parson").

One member of the party is designated as the narrator, and the small cards are distributed equally among the rest face down. As the narrator reads the story, he points to one of the players as he gets to each blank, and that player turns over his top card and reads it aloud. Merriment ensues.

200379.name: CameloD6
200379.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game is suitable for introducing new players to roleplaying games and concepts. Characters are defined by six Attributes (Fight, Muscle, Speed, Mind, Charm, and Magic) that have a numeric rating from 2 to 6. All Attributes start at a base number with additional points distributed during character creation. Action resolution involves rolling under the relevant Attribute on 1d6. The GM can impose situational modifiers as appropriate.

200380.name: Monopoly: Fox Cities
200380.description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Fox Cities of Northeastern Wisconsin.

200381.name: Lone Star-Opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
200381.description: Lone Star-Opoly hits the highlights with some of the province’s most interesting landmarks. Full of buffalo, crops, and parks, this game is truly about the Lone Star state. So choose your token and roll the dice. You may be competin’ in a Chili Cook-off... or wheelin’ and dealin’ in the big city.

200382.name: Demoniak
200382.description:
Words and a wild atmosphere!

Each round, a theme is revealed. Race the other players to find letter tiles that make a word related and be the first to ring the bell to place it! The longer the word, the more points you win... But be careful your opponents do not take the wind out of your sails ! What about the theme ? It is up to you : anything is possible as long as you can justify !

Demonstrate your imagination and speed to win the game !

Includes several modes to vary the pleasures.

Players: 2-6. Age: 8 and up . Duration : 20 min.

Contents: 120 cardboard tiles, 90 cards, 1 bell and 1 rule set.

200383.description:
A complete remake of the original game. Tiny Battle Publishing's game has new art, refined rules, die-cut counters.

/*** FLASH ***/

AMERICAN TROOPS ADVANCE ON MONTREAL

MARINE LANDINGS THREATEN HALIFAX, COUNTERED BY ROYAL NAVY

MONTREAL, September 1, 1939 (Roto-Reuters News Service, Earl Dixon reporting):

American President-for-Life Hugh Johnson's threats over securing unfettered access to the St. Lawrence River became deeds yesterday as troops of the American 1st and 27th Divisions lurched across the border into Canada. Elements of a United States Marine Corps brigade are reported to have landed at the small town of French Village, west of Halifax, and are advancing on the city.

Canadians were summoned to defend their homeland by the newly-appointed Defence Minister, John E. Mitchell.

"We will not permit these American scoundrels to pave our paradise and put up a parking lot," Mitchell warned. "All true Canadians will rise to defend our unique culture and way of life in this, our country's hour of need." (Mitchell was shortly thereafter the subject of a Vote of Censure by the Legislative Assembly of Quebec for having failed to make his remarks in French.)

Meanwhile, all units of the Non-Permanent Active Militia in all Militia Districts have received mobilization orders, though transport and equipment are lacking. Volunteer battalions have spontaneously formed in Montreal and Halifax as university students, local police, townsmen and farmers band together to resist the invasion. And the majesty of the British Empire has begun to make itself felt: a battalion of British troops are reported to have arrived at Quebec City; even more encouraging are sightings of Royal Navy and American ships engaged in heavy exchanges of fire off Halifax.

/*** -30- ***/

WAR PLAN CRIMSON is a simulation game of a hypothetical invasion of Canada by the United States some time between 1935 and 1939. The game is for two players, one representing the leader of the armed forces of the United States that could be deployed against Canada (the US player) and the other representing the commander of the Canadian and British forces that would defend against a foreign invasion (the Commonwealth or CW player).

In reality, both countries have enjoyed cordial relations but it is also historical fact that the United States Army did make plans to invade Canada, in the context of the ‘Rainbow’ war plans where potential enemy countries were referenced by colours (Japan was orange, Britain red, and Canada crimson - whence the title of the game). In most cases these plans were created, studied and maintained in order to keep staff officers sharp, but the strategic priorities of an actual plan submitted for consideration in 1935 (seizing Halifax and Montreal in a quick campaign before Britain could intervene decisively) are the obvious ones and have been used as the basic framework for the action in this game.
200383.name: War Plan Crimson

200384.name: Rugby à 2
200384.description:
Rugby à 2 is a card game. Each card can be used in attack (information on the top of the card) or defense (on the bottom of the card). In total, there are 110 cards and 24 different actions.

Each player has a hand of eight cards. The attacker player can play suites of cards in order to score (try or penalty). When the player plays a card in attack the information in the top of this card tells him which card it is possible to play now.

200385.description: The Plague Inc: 5th Player Expansion allows you to add a 5th player to the base game: Plague Inc: The Board Game.
200385.name: Plague Inc: 5th Player Expansion

200386.description:
The Patient Zero Pack was included as a Kickstarter exclusive to backers of Plague Inc: The Board Game.

This small expansion introduces two exclusive Trait Cards (Mass Hysteria and Strain Injury) and three exclusive Event Cards (Infect Board Game, Internet Shutdown, and Crowd Funded Soap).
200386.name: Plague Inc: Patient Zero Pack

200387.name: The Tongues of Our Ancestors
200387.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

When a nation is conquered, will its language survive? Play out scenes down the generations to find out: will the tongues of our ancestors still speak in the mouths of our grandchildren?

200388.name: Crucible of Heroes
200388.description:
A harrowing contest of skill, determination, and guile

From the introduction:

Crucible of Heroes is essentially a short dungeon crawl type of adventure. However, hidden under the gameplay is a complex and sophisticated storyline. As the players progress through it, they will discover clues, giving them many chances to piece together the plot. It isn’t necessary that the players do so, however. In fact, the adventure can be just as easily completed without doing so. If the players are not interested, they will be able to ignore the story elements and play the game as a basic dungeon crawl. But for players who ARE interested, the storyline is waiting to be uncovered.

A 3-4 session adventure for 12th level characters.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as seven separate PDF files:


Title Page
Chapter 0: Prologue
Chapter 1: Silverbay
Chapter 2: Outer Keep
Chapter 3: Inner Keep
Chapter 4: Dragon's Lair
Unique NPC Statistics

200389.name: Ugly Girl
200389.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the publisher's website:

A GAME ABOUT PERCEPTIONS, CONSENT, BODY SHAMING AND "GIRL-ON-GIRL HATE"

200390.name: Voices
200390.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

Voices is part a psychodrama and part a freeform larp about a common symptom of mental disorders. It gives people a chance to see and feel what it is like to go on in life while hearing voices.

200391.name: Waiting for Slenderman
200391.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

A game about the known, the unknown, and the imagined - as well as the power of creepypastas.

200392.name: Warmth
200392.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

Finding warmth in comforting rituals, such as knitting and food.

200393.name: A Way Out
200393.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

Play a member of a group who is not more comfortable in the group status quo. Change yourself by fighting back bad habits and social pressure.

200394.name: The Woods
200394.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

A collaborative game about two travelers lost in the woods and the nature of fairy tales.

200395.name: You Do (Not) Belong Here
200395.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

You Do (Not) Belong here is a game of bureaucratic politics, where the people involved do not always have the confidence to push forward their agenda. But they must somehow find solutions to the problems they face, or else the Arts Center might be closed for good!

200396.name: Long Range Desert Group: Special Operations Against Rommel 1941-1942
200396.description:
Long Range Desert Group (LRDG) is a solitaire game covering small-scale British operations against the Axis forces in North Africa. The player has to carry out one of four missions, or string all four together in a campaign game.

LRDG uses the Commando series rules. Each mission card grants the player a specified number of operations points to reach certain objectives. Operations points are expended to recruit the special ops team, then to move and attack on the map. A deck of event cards controls the opposition forces (OPFOR). Combat is resolved using a quasi-tactical system with opposing units taking turns firing at one another. Victory can increase the number of operations points available, but heavy losses can reduce them. The game ends when the player runs out of points.

Skills:

Level: Company-Battalion
Hex: 75 miles per inch

200397.name: Zeitgeist
200397.description:
Created for the 2015 Golden Cobra Challenge.

From the Golden Cobra Website:

Zeitgeist is a freeform game of limited communication, invented meaning, and the revelation of secrets, played out in the form of a seance. One player becomes the spirit-medium, speaking for the dead in reply to other players' questions, but constrained to converse using only a procedurally-generated corpus of responses.

200398.name: Cold Dark Earth
200398.description:
A murder that seems not quite normal. Dirty handprints marking the body and the surrounding area. Is this an isolated incident, or the beginning of a trail of bodies? Who contacted SAVE about this mysterious killing? Can the envoys discovered what pulled itself out of the cold, dark earth?

Summary from the beginning of the adventure

200399.name: The Invasive Invertebrates
200399.description:
Publisher blurb:

This Tweak & Toss "adventure seed" is a little different than most in that it is more of a background adventure that can be run concurrently with another adventure, or as a side-quest that would be of particular interest to a Druid PC. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to integrate with your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

The idea behind this Tweak & Toss is that there is an impending ecological disaster due to a small group of fishermen attempting to raise a rather invasive species of clam for profit. Nobody is aware of the fate that will befall this region if the fishermen's plans come to fruition.

200400.name: A Thief in the Night (Pathfinder)
200400.description:
From publisher blurb:

Several cases of delicious blackberry preserves have gone missing from Blackberry Bill’s. Braybin, the freckle-faced server, asks the PCs to help to discover who is responsible and to get the jam back before Blackberry Bill notices – and reminds the townsfolk why he was formerly known as Butcher Bill.

Thief in the Night is designed to accompany Tangible Taverns: Trio of Taverns and is suitable for four characters of level 3-4.

Tavern Tales: Mini Adventures are two page Pathfinder RPG compatible adventures designed to accompany various Tangible Taverns by Dire Rugrat Publishing but may be easily inserted into your own tavern or campaign.

200402.name: The Righteous & Corrupted - Two Sorcerer Bloodlines
200402.description:
From publisher blurb:

This promotional issue provides two new Sorcerer Bloodlines built upon the class features of the Paladin and Anti-Paladin. Providing more options to take on the mantle of purity and might or Corruption and Vengeance.

200403.name: Sunshine in Maine
200403.description:
Her voice was childlike, calling my name from across the bonfire, asking if I would take her to the sunshine. I got up from the fire and made my way to the looming iron gate. From beyond it, my name wavered across the wind. “Amanda, Amanda. I want to see my sunshine.”

My feet crunched across the dead grass as I crossed the threshold, and she takes my hands and leads me away in a chorus of “You Are My Sunshine.”

Summary from the beginning of the adventure

200404.name: Blink Dog & Gorgon
200404.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the next installment of Monster Mash. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover a two creature the deadly Gorgon and the Blink Dog. These two creatures have terrorized caravans and traveling parties for year.

A Gorgon is a large bull-like creature with armor plates as skin. It can breathe a large gas cloud that will turn anything to stone. Blink Dogs are a large canine that can teleport around a given area during combat. This maneuver will confuse an opponent, which give the Blink Dog a great advantage in combat

200405.name: Time Magic
200405.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time Magic is the spell used by Timelords the guardians of the fabric of time. These powerful spells can age an individual, make them younger, protect the mage from attacks and even carry them vast distances. It is said that Timelords can see into the future and the past as well as know of dangers before they even encounter them.

This supplement for Fantasy Hero will give a description of the abilities and the spells used by Time Mages or Timelords if you prefer. The supplement includes PDF as well as Hero Designer files.

200406.name: WeQu
200406.description:
WeQu is a fun card game to get to know people in minutes while revealing the best qualities about yourself – for relationship and work. Players win the game by obtaining higher WeQu Scores between players based few factors. They are common qualities they share together and the level of understanding between each players. Players use WeQu app to unlock scores and record the score.

In weQu app there is a leaderboard where player can compare scores and see the development of one's play history.

The WeQu deck is composed of cards describing essential virtues and characteristics. Players take turns drawing two cards and selecting the card that best fits their playing partner. As you draw cards and learn about others, you also discover how the world sees you, all in a positive game.

When players completed the card deck, you will get a unique arrangement of cards that represent your personality and characteristics. Use WeQu app to capture the results and unlock the WeQu score.

200407.name: Rummy 17
boardgamepublisher: テンデイズゲームズ (Ten Days Games)
200407.description:
Rummy 17 is a somewhat standard rummy game in that players want to meld sets and runs — and play cards on the sets and runs of others — in order to rid themselves of cards. A round ends whenever one player discards their final card, then everyone else loses 1 or 2 points for each card still in hand.

At the start of a round, five goal cards are chosen at random from the deck, and at the end of the round each player who has satisfied a goal card scores points for doing so. On a turn, a player draws the top card from either the deck or the discard pile; if they draw from the deck, then other players have the option of knocking to take the top card from the discard pile. A player must lay down a set or run of at least three cards before being able to play on opponents' sets and runs, and a player must discard one card at the end of their turn, including their final turn when they go out.

After a predetermined number of rounds, whoever has the highest score wins.

Rummy 17 includes one joker card in each of the five suits, with each suit being numbered 1-17. A player can use the joker when laying down a run as long as the run includes at least three numbered cards. This joker can be replaced with the actual number on a later turn as long as the player who does so immediately uses the joker in a new run.

200408.name: The Golden Cobra Anthology 2015
rpg: Blessed be the Host of the King of Heaven
For a Long Time I Would Go to Bed Early
It Was a Very Good Year
Making Up is Hard to Do
This Folks At The Dining Room
Too Much Slap on the Ecaf
200408.description:
From the Golden Cobra website:

The goal of the 2015 contest is to generate small, intense, personal games. Golden Cobras will be awarded in five categories:


Best use of themes/techniques for evoking empathy
Best incorporation of perspectives of unheard or marginalized people or groups
Best incorporation of touch
Game we're most excited about
Most polished and ready-to-play game


In order to be considered for a Golden Cobra, your game must:


Be playable from start to finish in two hours or less, by people who are not you.
Playable by a fixed or variable but small number of participants, from zero to four

200409.name: Resistor (Issue 1 - May 2016)
200409.description: RESISTOR vol. 1 features fiction, games, and art about class and access.

200410.name: Granjeros
200410.description:
The first thing you should know about Granjeros is that it belongs to a new breed of games, the "B Games" family. B Games seek to teach values and principles about building a more fair and sustainable world, in a fun way. Some of these principles are: Acknowledging a new meaning of success, promoting collaboration, environmental awareness and protection, and social development among others.

---

The game is a 4 to 5 player game where each player is a farmer who has come to a land full of opportunities to develop in a sustainable manner plots of land. Although each player is competing with other players to win the game, collaboration, trust and and holistic approach to growth are quintessential to progressing in the game. Thus players compete and collaborate with each other as well as become accountable as a group for the common resources that impact the whole system. The game ends when one or more players reach a total of 7 B points. Yes!, in a Granjeros game there can be one or more winning players simultaneously.

Granjeros is a turn based game fashioned under European style boardgames. That means that although one player holds his turn, other players play along actively while not in their turn. There is always something to do wether you it is your turn or not. The central hexagon is where the water well is located. The water well is a key element of Granjeros gameplay as it influences all players in every turn and will determine the conditions for harvesting and selling crops. Inside the water well you will find 7 water buckets.

Each turn has the following structure & steps:

a) Take a bucket of water out of the well (put it in front of you).
b) Throw the 8 harvest dice. Check for "pairs" of vegetable/fruits.
c) For every pair, reward each player the corresponding vegetable/fruits and number according the type of plot he has [orchard, barn, farm or industry].
d) Invest resources [land, technology, farmers, seed] to develop your plots either individually or in collaboration with other players.
e) Negotiate and dialogue with other players to plan for future developments.
Regardless that it is somebody else's turn all players are entitled to negotiate and dialogue at all times during the game.

Every time you evolve your plots, either individually or collaboratively, to higher level of development you will earn B points. First player(s) to reach 7 B points win the game!

200411.name: Light Blaster
200411.description:
User Summary

Pistol controller with light sensors to use with CRT monitors. There are two trigger buttons; A push and pull mechanism.
Above the handle there are two Start buttons; one on each side, so can be used for left and right hand thumb.
Above the Start button there is a switch to select between four settings: Nor., IR, AR+AF and SET.

On the front hand rest there is a Hyper button on the right side.

200412.name: APA-L (Issue 510 - Feb 1975)
200412.description:
APA-L
510th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1958
February 20, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200413.description:
Cotto & Frullato is a game for only cool people. You've been recruited into a team of legendary action movie stars in the most epic competition in history. Finally the world will see who will be the best badass of all. Your task will be to taste different dishes that have been blended to pulp, recognize their nutritional benefits and assign them to each star of your team, in order to bring him / her to their highest physical supremacy.

All the stars will face 4 Challenges: Strength, Resistance, Coolness and Charisma. But as we all know, physical strength is not enough. To win the Challenges you will need to let your stars drink cooked and blended dishes, so that every fiber of their organism can be pervaded by the right nutrients. Carbohydrates increase the strength, Fats increase the resistance, Proteins increase the coolness and Vitamins increase the charisma. Pay close attention, because the final victory will depend on your choices.

First of all each player gets 2 or 3 stars each (according to the number of players), revealing them.
There are 2 stages: in the first one each player get some cards that represent dishes that have been blended with a drink. Each dish is divided into 5 ingredients. Players will place on the table 6 tokens (5 ingredients and 1 drink). All tokens are true (so they have a correspondence with those indicated on each card) but one, that is false. The opponents should guess whether an ingredient is true or false. They bet on one of theit choice thanks to their own double-faced token (1 side indicates TRUE, the other side indicates FALSE). Clearly betting on the false ingredient is harder, but it gives you a lot of rewards.

Betting on ingredients allow players to obtain nutrition cards, that can improve the basic values of the stars. Carbohydrates improve Strength, Fats improve Resistance, Proteins improve Coolness and Vitamins improve Charisma.

After all players played their dish cards allowing the opponents to guess ingredients and collect nutrition cards to assign to their stars, the stage 2 starts.

All stars will face 4 challenges: Strength, Resistance, Coolness and Charisma. Players reveals all cards of each challenge assigned to the stars. The character with the highest score gains 3 victory points, the second only 1. In case of tie all characters at the first position gain 2 VP, while all characters at the second one gain 1 VP.
Then pass to the second challenge and so on. Each character, however, has a skill that can influence several moments of the game, making the results of the challenges always unpredictable.

At the end of the game, the team's player with the highest rank (calculating the total amount of rewards of each star of his team) is the winner. In case of tie, the player with more nutrition cards assigned to his team is the winner. In further case of tie, players share the victory.
200413.name: Cotto & Frullato: The Game

200414.name: APA-L (Issue 511 - Feb 1975)
200414.description:
APA-L
511th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1959
February 27, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200415.name: Adorable to Horrible
200415.description:
Adorable to Horrible is an adult party game for 2-4 players. It's a game that's easy to learn and play, so you can quickly get to the fun and debauchery! Choose one of the four "Adorables," do your best to keep them safe in their Happy Place cloud, while you push your opponents' characters down the stony steps, toward "The Nasty Void!"

Each player has three pawns, which are moved along a track. Each turn, a player plays a movement card, which moves a specific type of pawn along the track. Alternatively, he can play an event card with some random effect.

The game ends when all three pawns of one player have reached the end of the track - the nasty void. The other players get points depending on how far along the track their pawns are. The player with the lowest score wins the game.

200416.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 91 - May 2016)
rpgissuearticle: The Tom eof the Black Island
Thought Table: The Power of a Good Reputation
200416.description:
Magic Like Lightning, So Shocking and Dangerous

Where wizards duel and a dark tome hides, where metal spells and foul brews reside, where spirits lurk in machines to awake, let this Pyramid help your magic to make! The latest installment of Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - is another assortment of arcane-expanding miscellany, perfect to add all manner of new excitement to your GURPS game. Within the uncanny pages of Pyramid #3/91: Thaumatology IV, you shall discover:


"Technomysticism," a new magical field that might be found in the world of GURPS Monster Hunters. This feature showcases a new champion - the technomystic - plus details on technologically oriented abilities (including Machine Whisperer, Repairing Touch, Machine-Jinx), GURPS stats on several tech spirits, and more. It also includes information on how to work with the netrunning abilities from Pyramid #3/21: Cyberpunk.
"The Tome of the Black Island," a horrifying book with the power to sacrifice others, force obedience, summon terrible gods, and more. This systemless guide includes a history of the tome and its creation, its dark scribed powers, and adventure ideas.
"Dark Alchemy," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Banestorm: Abydos author David L. Pulver. The sinister potions herein will allow you to create zombies, repel ghosts, preserve heads, and demonstrate other unsavory abilities.
"The Thaumaturgy of Metallurgy," a look at how to make a Metal college of spells, using the GURPS Magic foundation. Unleash the power of dozens of new Magic spells - including Blunderbuss, Rust, and Walk Through Metal - or just summon a variety of metal elementals (including GURPS stats).
"Codex Duello," a guide to how to conduct and resolve duels among mages, from master Pyramid penman Christopher R. Rice. Resolve disputes or simply fight to the death, whether you're using GURPS Magic, GURPS Thaumatology: Ritual Path Magic, GURPS Thaumatology: Sorcery, or even GURPS Psionic Powers!


This issue also provides a Random Thought Table with a new kind of magic that turns fame on its head, plus another vignette from Matt Riggsby set in the new Car Wars universe that peeks into the garages of the future. Regardless of what flavor of magic you use in your GURPS game, this Pyramid is sure to provide some amazing new sorcerous spice!

- Publisher's description

200417.name: Whitestar Source Book
200417.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mega corporations could not flee fast enough from the irradiated and chemically saturated Earth. They assumed that nothing could survive amongst the acid-scarred ruins of their birthplace. Not until they returned in the hopes of finding plunder amongst the rubble did they realise how wrong their assumptions had been. Following the example of their beloved Tsarina, Whitestar has founded an empire amongst the tunnels and Strongholds below the wastelands. One that sits ready to defend their ancient homeland no matter the cost.

Inside this lavish 96 page full colour source book:

Delve into the history of the Whitestar Federation and discover the untold facts about their growth into a power to be reckoned with.
Survival and Exploration: The Federation has managed to flourish despite the many dangers that now stalk the Wastelands. Tread carefully in their footsteps across the frozen wastes, and avoid the blood red winds.
The Tsarina’s People: Become one of Tsarina’s chosen using the expanded rules for the backgrounds and professions unique to Whitestar.
Ancient Technology: The technicians of Whitestar have become experts in bricolage out of necessity. Take a firsthand look at some of the machines and devices they have cobbled together.

200418.name: Per's Gadgets and Computers
200418.description:
From publisher blurb:

A corner store in the station’s shopping district, Per’s Gadgets and Computers (PGC) looks like any other technology store at first glance. Looking more closely, however, one discovers a large variety of unique and useful gadgets in addition to the standard tech gear and computer hardware. Many of the items for sale are unique and designed and created by Per himself. Are you looking for something a little off the beaten path? Do you have an idea for a device that would make your life easier? PGC is the place to go.

If you take that annoying cousin that is always talking about the latest technology and gadgets and combine him with that old crazy uncle that is always telling wild, impossible-seeming stories, that's Per Arnoldson. He is obsessed with the newest gear and tech and always like to talk about it and show it off. The difference is that while your cousin may talk big and not really know much and you're pretty sure your uncle's stories are complete fabrications, Per knows his stuff and the stories are probably true.

200419.name: Underground Base Entrance
200419.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 303rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a heavily fortified entrance to an underground base.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

200420.name: Defense Boats and Light Warships Second Edition
200420.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ships of Clement Sector 7-9: Defense Boats and Light Warships compiles the seventh, eighth and ninth volumes of our popular PDF starship series. Included within this book are the Perth-class frigate, the Berlin-class, the Type 2 System Security Cutter, and the Rattlesnake-class Attack Craft.

Each ship is beautifully detailed with multiple views, detailed deckplans and full statistics. Also included are several NPCs and adventure hooks to get these vessels quickly and easily into your campaign.

While each of these ships has been specifically designed to fit into the Clement Sector setting, they could easily be used in other settings or within other science fiction RPGs if needed.

200421.name: Workhorses Second Edition
200421.description:
From publisher blurb:

The workhorses get it done!

Ships of Clement Sector 10-12 compiles the tenth, eleventh and twelfth volumes of our popular PDF series. Included within this book are the Lee-class merchant vessel, the Fedpost mail courier, and the Broken Hill-class Prospector. We have also included the Wraith-class Intruder and the Venture-class Troop Transport, variants of the courier and the prospector respectively.

Each ship is beautifully detailed with multiple views, detailed deckplans and full statistics. Also included are several NPCs and adventure hooks to get these vessels quickly and easily into your campaign.

While each of these ships has been specifically designed to fit into the Clement Sector setting, they could easily be used in other settings or within other science fiction RPGs if needed.

200422.name: Performance Mega Memory Card
200422.description: Released by Performance to be used in lieu of the system's VMU. 512kB memory (This memory card saves 800 blocks of memory on four pages.)

200423.name: APA-L (Issue 512 - Mar 1975)
200423.description:
APA-L
512th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1960
March 6, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200424.name: APA-L (Issue 513 - Mar 1975)
200424.description:
APA-L
513th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1961
March 13, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200425.name: Hephaestus
200425.description:
From time to time, blacksmiths from all around the world gather in a competition that shall decide who is the world's best blacksmith, the only one entitled to the blessing of Hephaestus, the god of the forge. But not all are worthy of such honor, and only those artisans able to create the best weapons, armor and shields have a chance.
Hephaestus is a simple, yet very involving game that brings all the strategy from the worker placement mechanics using only cards. Each blacksmith has a special skill and a single specialty. On her turn, the player must choose one of the actions of the game and pick up the card of that action:


Buy resources
Purchase contracts
Buy improvements for weapons
And Install Improvements


Each contract describes how to create an equipment, which can be either a weapon, an armor or a shield, and shows the resources and the amount of work needed to create the equipment. For each piece of equipment you will need to heat the metal, cool it down and then smash it with your hammer! The required time for each step depends on the equipment, and the time you will actually take to forge it depends on the action cards you will take during the game. Each time you complete a contract, you receive the number of victory points described in it, earning bonus points according to their powers and their improvements! The game ends when the contract card deck is over, and the blacksmith who has the most victory points is the winner!

Game Components:
- 104 Cards
- 4 players boards
- 26 Resource tokens

200426.name: Peter Rabbit - Endless Text Runner of the Beatrix Potter Classic Tale
200426.description:
Beatrix Potter's classic tale re-imagined for the app generation. Now you can play one of the most popular children's books as an endless text runner.

Venture into Mr. McGregor's Garden, munch on vegetables, but watch out for Mr. McGregor!

Source: The Publisher Website.

200427.description:
Promotional card given out at Tabletop day 2016.

Admiral's Tabletop
Event
Each player may shuffle their discard pile into their deck. If they don't, they gain 5 Authority

"When an event enters the trade row, do what it says immediately, then scrap it."
200427.name: Star Realms: Admiral's Tabletop

200428.name: The Great Modron March Conversion (5e)
200428.description:
From the introduction:

This is an easy conversion for all mechanics in the campaign The Great Modron March from Planescape Campaign Setting to Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition). You must own the original campaign book to use this conversion.

User summary:

Presents a page-by-page conversion with replacement text.

200429.name: APA-L (Issue 514 - Mar 1975)
200429.description:
APA-L
514th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1962
March 20, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200430.description:
Elevenses for One and Bowling Solitaire is a set of two solitaire games, each previously released on their own.

In Elevenses for One, the player must load their tea trolley with all the accoutrements required for a splendid morning tea before the clock strikes 11!

The game consists of only eleven cards — each with specific actions the player must choose to follow or ignore, possibly to their detriment — with the goal being to load the tea trolley correctly within fifteen actions.

In Bowling Solitaire, standard playing cards are used to simulate a round of bowling.
200430.name: Elevenses for One and Bowling Solitaire

200431.name: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang Switcheroo Card Game
200431.description:
This 1968 card game is visually a spin-off from the hit movie, but the mechanism is essentially the same as Crazy Eights. This deck has 44 cards in four suits, each numbering 1 to 11. Each number has an illustration of a character, with the 8s being Chitty Chitty Bang Bang the car.

Each player is dealt a hand of five cards. The rest are face down as a draw deck, and the top of the draw deck becomes the card to match. Each player in turn must play a card from hand that matches either the number or the suit. Chitty Chitty Bang Bang cards are wild, can be played on any card, and allow the player to specify the suit that must be matched by the next player. First player to empty his hand wins.

There are no other special or "pick-up" cards that usually figure in Crazy Eight games.

200432.description:
A fast-paced dice game that simulates the most exciting part an of American Football game, the final 2-minute drive.

The Offense player is down by 4 with two minutes to play. With simple play calls and fast-rolling dice, the Defense player guesses the play call for chance at a big play while the Offense player works to fill up the board with successes and drive down the field to score the winning touchdown!

A perfect two-player filler game for tailgating, halftime, road trips, and more, Hurry-Up Offense offers the flavor of live-action American football for both casual and die-hard football fanatics.
200432.name: Hurry-Up Offense

200433.name: APA-L (Issue 515 - Mar 1975)
200433.description:
APA-L
515th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1963
March 27, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200434.name: APA-L (Issue 516 - Apr 1975)
200434.description:
APA-L
516th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1964
April 3, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200435.name: APA-L (Issue 517 - Apr 1975)
200435.description:
APA-L
517th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1965
April 10, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200437.name: APA-L (Issue 518 - Apr 1975)
200437.description:
APA-L
518 Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1966
April 17, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200438.name: Malifaux Second Edition: Smoke and Mirrors
200438.description:
Second edition box set for Colette. Contains Collette, three Mechanical Doves (totems), Cassandra (Henchman), two Performers, two Mannequins. Box is in plastic and must be assembled. Contains relevant character and upgrade cards.

Collette is an Arcanist master who concentrates on dropping scheme markers and manipulating markers. She is a showgirl model and works well with showgirls.

200439.name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Vengeful Spirits
200439.description:
Second Edition box set for Kirai. Box contains Kirai, Lost Love (totem), Ikiriyo (only summonable by Kirai, two Seishin (only summonable) and two Onryo. Box is in plastic and must be assembled. Box contains relevant character and upgrade cards.

Kirai is a ressurectionist master who specializes in summning spirits and manipulating spirits. The box contains three models that can only be summoned, so it contains a lower soul stone count than is normal for a crew set.

200440.name: Youtubers Life
200440.description:
Youtubers Life is the ultimate life simulation/tycoon videogame in which you can become the world’s greatest video blogger in history. Edit videos, expand the amount of fans and turn yourself into a wealthy fellow.

Source: The Game Website.

200441.name: Insincere
200441.description:
User Summary

After waking up in a strangely deserted science facility with no recollection of how you got there, you hear the voice of an A.I. The A.I. promises to be your guide and to help you out of the facility.

200442.name: SMASHING THE BATTLE
200442.description:
In the year 2085, a huge multiplex construction site becomes a victim of a massive-scale hacking incident. Due to the hack, the construction robots start to attack the workers onsite.

Source: The Game Website.

200443.description: The scenario is set in 1882 and contains an average amount of combat (but nothing gory). It is suitable for most older kids and families. There are a couple of tricky puzzles that may stall progress until they are solved.
200443.name: Switching Gears (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)

200444.name: APA-L (Issue 519 - Apr 1975)
200444.description:
APA-L
519th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1967
April 24, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200446.name: APA-L (Issue 521 - May 1975)
200446.description:
APA-L
521st Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1969
May 8, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200447.name: Family Feud: DVD Game
200447.description:
Here's your chance to play America's favorite game show on DVD with the all-new Family Feud DVD game!

Just like the actual game show, you'll now be playing double and triple money rounds, with the chance to steal the money and the round.

With the updated game play and hundreds of new questions, it's hours of fun for the whole family!

The game deals with 2 players at home, trying to match all the Top 5 answers on the survey, with a twist. Both players must try to out score the opponent by scoring the most points on each question round. With a pair of duel question rounds where both must answer the same survey question, and the fast money question round where both are given seperate questions to answer, and match the surveys.

200448.name: APA-L (Issue 522 - May 1975)
200448.description:
APA-L
522nd Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1970
May 15, 1975

200451.name: Wings.io
200451.description:
User Summary

Wings.io is another .io game in which players can log in to a game in progress and attempt to survive as long as possible while aiming for the highest score.
In Wings.io, player fly planes and attempt to shoot each other down using the basic gun or the various powerups that fall from the sky.

Other popular .io games include Slither.io, Agar.io, and Vertix.io.

200454.description:
Matter swirls around a new born star, coalescing on the planetoids that orbit it. Planets evolve, grow and migrate in their orbits, forming a unique solar system by the end of every game. Planetarium is a game of creation, chaos and terraforming on the grandest scale.

Players are competing to crash combinations of elements onto planets that then allow them to play cards to evolve the planets in a variety of ways, with each player looking to evolve planets in the system to suit their own secret endgame goals.

On a turn a player will firstly move a matter or planet token in a clockwise direction around the star. The board is mapped with a series of lines, tracing orbits around the star, and it is along these lines that the tokens are moved. If a matter token moves onto a space occupied by planet token then the matter token is placed on the player's mat (on the respective planet). In the same way, planets can also be moved onto matter tokens, placing the matter tokens on the player's mat.

In the second part of a turn a player can play Evolution cards from their hand at the cost of the matter tokens they have collected on their player mat (some cards have other special requirements to play). If a player plays a card, they score the cards points and check to see if their card has changed the state of the planet from hostile to habitable by checking the total habitable and hostile points played to the planet (some end game goals require planets to be hostile or habitable). The player may then draw a card from one of three decks, Low Evolution (cards that score less points but require less matter to play), High Evolution (cards that score more and are harder to play), and Final Evolution (cards that can only be played on a player's final turn).

The thematics of the game have been developed with an eye on the science, led by a scientist working on NASA's search for life on Mars. Evolution cards thematically include all kinds of planetary phenomenon, from asteroid impacts, atmospheric effects, to geological events. Final Evolution cards mark the relatively stable state a planet is in at the end of the solar system's development and include classifications for the final planets such as Hot Jupiter or an uninhabitable frozen dwarf planet.

The game consists of a beautiful game board with handfuls of matter tokens, approximately 36 Evolution cards and 16 Final Evolution cards (all with unique space art and flavor), player mats, and player and score markers.
200454.name: Planetarium

Episode 23 part 1: Mars, Tsuro and Planetarium
There's No Such Thing as a Cool Cup
Vox Republica 138: Havens Of Gloooooom

200456.description:
Ascension is a deck-building game in which players spend Runes to acquire more powerful cards for their deck. It offers a dynamic play experience where players have to react and adjust their strategy accordingly. Each player starts with a small deck of cards, and uses those cards to acquire more and better cards for their deck, with the goal of earning the most Honor Points by gaining cards and defeating monsters.

The theme for Ascension X: War of Shadows, the tenth set in this game series, is the on-going conflict between Light and Dark forces for control of New Vigil. This conflict plays a direct role in the game as the balance between the two forces can give players additional powers during Night and Day. A new category of Heroes and Constructs are also introduced, and these powerful dual-cost cards require players to spend both types of game resources to purchase them.
200456.name: Ascension X: War of Shadows
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 29 - GenCon 2016 Two-Player Preview

200457.name: Maranatha
200457.description:
"A uniquely edifying game" where 2 - 6 players move around a Monopoly-style board collecting Word, Revival and Treasure cards and trying to avoid being under Attack.

Players take turns to roll dice and collect cards depending on the space that is landed on:

Word: Collect a Word card which has a Biblical verse on it.
Treasure: Collect a Treasure card
Revival: Collect a Revival card, once you have collected a full set, you are in "Revival" and can collect two cards when you land on a Treasure space.
Attack: Draw an Attack card and play the matching Word card to counter it.
Jesus: You can "Minister" to another player under "Attack" by drawing a Word card for them.

The winner is the person with the most Treasure when the Maranatha card is drawn. The Maranatha card is in the Treasure deck.

The box promises "a game of spiritual insight for all the family."

200458.name: Riddle Moo This
200458.description: Riddle Moo This is a children's game. All the players has a button to press, that makes a Moo sound, and gives them a chance to answer the riddle. The players draw a card. On each card there is three clues to what the riddle's answer is. Players read one clue after another. And them someone want's to take a guess they press there Moo button. The first player to guess right get's one point. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

200460.name: AmiTech MaxiMem
200460.description:
User Summary

Memory expansion card for Amiga 500/500+. Comes with a 512kb RAM expansion but can be expanded up to 2.5MB (1.8MB and above require Gary adapter).

The expansion also have a CPU adapter that can expand the Amiga 500 chip memory to 1MB.

The card is connected in the Trapdoor slot underneath the Amiga 500/500+

200461.name: Fist Fighter
200461.description:
User Summary

Your usual arcade style fighting game for 1-2 players, where you can fight in three different locations; Egypt, Japan or USA.
Apart from location you can choose your difficulty and choose one of five fighters.

Each fight is maximum 99 seconds long.

200462.name: Gem'X
200462.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game where you change the colour of gems in the screens left window to match the gems in the right window.

When you complete a stage, a more or less covered lady appear.

200463.name: Sums in Space
200463.description: Sums in Space is a children's game. The game has a board with a start and a finish. The winner is the player first to reach the goal. To get there the player roll three dice, two with number on then, and one with - or +. The player then organise the dice to get a sum, and then move the sum on the board. On some spots on the board the sum must be even or odd.

200464.name: All Around the Playground
200464.description: All Around the Playground is a children's game. The player spin a spinner that shows different symbols, like cube, triangle, heart or star. The player then move his/her pawn to the next spot on the board with the matching symbol. First player around the playground on the board and back to the school, that is the finish, is the winner. There is three shortcuts on the board. Includes a game board, 4 game markers with stands and a spinner. Game board measures 16” x 16”.

200466.name: Powerdrome
200466.description:
User Summary

Racing game about the future: Hovering race cars in a half pipe track at full speed!

200467.description:
Perfect Crime is an asymmetrical, modern day, tower defense-style bank robbery game with hidden information and tons of tension that's based on heists both real and imagined.

To set up, one player builds the perfect bank using a double-sided modular game board that's designed to give the banker maximum control over how they want to play. Aside from building the bank itself, they set up patrol routes for guards to ensure that the robbers never face the same bank twice. Once the bank blueprint is set, it needs a state-of-the-art security system that will prove impossible to defeat...or so the bank hopes.

The robber's job is to pick apart those carefully planned defenses by assembling a crew of specialists and equipping them with the tools and weapons they'll need. Robbers can choose to scout out the bank's security or go straight in for a quick smash-and-grab heist. Robbers choose which game mode to play: co-op (working together against the bank), semi co-op (kind of working together against the bank), or competitively (pretending to work together, but shooting each other in the back).
200467.name: Perfect Crime
boardgamepodcastepisode: 12. Devon Dice go to UK Games Expo 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 030b – Essen 2016
Episode 28 - Star Trek, Perfect Crime and Doom
Henry Jasper and Perfect Crime  - Boards & Swords #61
The Polyhedron Collider Cast - UK Games Expo 2016

200468.name: RVF Honda
200468.description:
User Summary

Race the legendary Honda RC-80 racer to your way to the top of the grand prix.

Can be connected with a null-modem to race player vs. player - even Atari ST vs Amiga!

200469.name: Picnic Party
200469.description: Picnic Party is a children's game. The game has a board, and is card driven. The players play as ants and the winner is the first one to the picnic basket, the goal, on the board. All players draw a card, they then compare their numbers, the player with the highest number moves the number of steps that he/she has more than the card is the second highest. There is four shortcuts on the board. Includes a board, 4 ant game markers and 48 cards. Game board measures 16” x 16”.

200470.name: High Seas ADDventure
200470.description: High Seas ADDventure is a children's game. The player draw cards until the numbers on the cards is more the 10. He/she then sums how many cards there is and moves on the board (eg a 4 card and a 6 cards makes 2 cards, and the player moves 2 steps). The first player to the goal is the winner. The theme of the game is to sail the seas. Includes a board, 4 game markers and 56 cards. Game board measures 16” x 16”.

200471.name: QuickShot Apache-1 QS-131
200471.description:
User Summary

Atari 9-pin connected joystick - a classic that is seen everywhere!

The QS-131 have an ergonomic handle and two buttons in the top of the handle:
One on the front for the trigger finger, and one on the top (back) for the thumb.

It have four suction cups for stabilizing.

200475.name: Dice Nutz Pro Football
200475.description:
Dice Nutz Pro Football is a realistic fast-paced, simulation game played using dice and charts. Pro player's offensive and defensive abilities directly impact the action on each & every roll of the dice. Play head to head or solitaire and coach your favorite team to victory by maximizing your team's strengths while exploiting your opponent's weaknesses.
Will you grind down your opponent's defense with a beastly, smash-mouth rushing attack? Or will you spread the field and allow your future hall of fame quarterback to lead a lethal, down-field aerial assault? Will you implement a 3-4 zone blitz defensive scheme, or do you have a shut-down secondary that excels in man to man coverage? DICE NUTZ PRO FOOTBALL features dozens of offensive & defensive plays & formations which allow you to craft a gameplan that best suits your personnel. Breakaways, audibles, play action passes, fake punts & field goals, multiple blitz packages, double teams...you name it, it's in here! Play the advanced version for the most realistic gridiron simulation, or try a basic "quick play" version for a fun, casual, yet statistically accurate experience.

200476.name: Hoop Nutz Pro Basketball
200476.description:
Hoop Nutz Pro Basketball is a realistic fast-paced, simulation game played using dice and charts. Pro player's offensive and defensive abilities directly impact the action on each & every roll of the dice. Play head to head or solitaire and coach your favorite team to victory by maximizing your team's strengths while exploiting your opponent's weaknesses.
Find yourself immersed in a world of momentum changing 3 pointers, fast-breaks, steals, soul-crushing blocks, clutch free throws and last second buzzer beaters. Your decisions are dictated by your team's style of play. Are you built to shoot three's, or do you have a dominant big man to feed in the paint? Do you thrive in transition, or are you better off patiently working the ball up the court? You'll need to know your team if you want a shot at championship glory!

200477.name: Ice Nutz Pro Hockey
200477.description:
Ice Nutz Pro HOckey is a realistic fast paced, simulation game played using dice and charts. Pro player's offensive and defensive abilities directly impact the action on each & every roll of the dice. Play head to head or solitaire and coach your favorite team to victory by maximizing your team's strengths while exploiting your opponent's weaknesses.
Ice Nutz features precision passing, skating, shooting, checking, rebounds, breakaways, glove saves, line changes, penalties, power plays, shootouts, injuries, even fighting...It's all in here! Play head to head or solitaire. Play a full season, or just the playoffs...maybe with the right breaks you can claim the Cup as your own!

200478.name: Soccer Nutz Dice Futball
200478.description:
Soccer Nutz Dice Futball is a realistic fast-paced, simulation game played using dice and charts. Pro player's offensive and defensive abilities directly impact the action on each & every roll of the dice. Play head to head or solitaire and coach your favorite team to victory by maximizing your team's strengths while exploiting your opponent's weaknesses.
Soccer Nutz features everything that makes the "Beautiful Game" beautiful! Amazing crosses, incredible headers, unbelievable saves. Perfectly executed free kicks, corner kicks & goal kicks. Fouls, yellow cards, red cards and penalty kicks. Dribbling, breakaways, rebounds, offensive & defensive strategy...it's all in here!

200479.name: The Battle of Ogre's Knee
200479.description:
From the publisher:

"A Four Player Abstract Strategy Game with Goblins"
Comprises a leather board 15" x 15" and wooden pieces; all hand-finished. Each player controls an army of Giants, Ogres, Trolls, Dwarves, Hobgoblins and Goblins, battling for land in the prized turnip-growing valley of Ogre's Knee.

At the start the four armies are positioned at the corners of the board. The initial aim of the armies, of which each constituent has a different numerical value, is to capture opposing pieces. Capture is custodial, captors having to have a higher combined value than those being captured. Players can combine in capture. Capture is rewarded by gold, which, when sufficient has accumulated, allows an army to build a monument. Further gold allows players to build walls around the territory they dominate, enclosing both men and monument.

The primary aim of the Battle is to capture territory on the board; and the winner is the player who captures and encloses the largest territory.

200480.name: Time of the Wolves
200480.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time of the Wolves is an epic saga of four linked adventures for the Age of Arthur roleplaying game.

Your band of heroes are at the heart of the struggle to save the Kingdom of Ebrauc from the menacing Angle invaders.

The ravenous noble sons of the ruling dynasty of the Angles, the Wuffingas, are hunting glory and conquest. Ebrauc is the tasty morsel that they are vying over.

Strong sword arms and brave hearts will not suffice. In these adventures your heroes will fight heroic battles, undertake difficult negotiations, meet fearsome monsters, discover lost treasures, encounter the beguiling Fae, sing songs in smoky halls, drawing on every ounce of heroism and sacrifice.

The wolves are circling.

Can you keep them at bay?

200481.name: My Friends are Weird
200481.description: My Friends are Weird is a meta party game. When friends come by for a picnic, movie night, party, game night, or just general hanging out, they each pick a card and keep it secret. Each card has an action detailed on it that is out of the ordinary. The players’ goal is to perform that action without anyone catching on that it is being done for the game. People must notice you are doing the action (unless the card says otherwise). The trick is to try to incorporate it into the context of whatever it is you happen to be doing at the time. If, at the end of the night, you’ve pulled it off, you get points based on how tricky the action is to get away with. If you get caught (if someone guesses that you did something weird for the game), you lose any points that you have acquired from that card. You cannot take another card until (1) you are successful with the first one or (2) you get caught doing the first one. If there is debate over whether or not you accomplished something, the group as a whole decides at the end of the night if you pulled it off; partial credit is permitted at the group’s discretion. If the action is something that you would do anyways; congratulations, you are a natural at this game and you are weird.

200482.name: Green Thumbs
200482.description: Green Thumbs is a tile placement and deck building game. Build a competitive deck of resource cards to purchase plant tiles to add to your vegetable garden. Points are earned based on the difficulty of growing that particular vegetable and where it is placed within the garden.

200483.description:
Barony: Sorcery, the first expansion to Barony, brings magic to the world, with a sixth action now available to the players that allows them to cast powerful spells. Before they can cast spells, however, they need mana, and only a few places on the board allow them to collect those precious mana points. The battle for control and access to these places will be hard!

Barony: Sorcery stays true to the base game as the new elements add no luck to the game, instead opening up possibilities for players to bend the rules, thereby adding even more tension to the board. This expansion also adds components for a fifth player: new tiles, new wooden components, new player aid.
200483.name: Barony: Sorcery

200484.name: NotCoD
200484.description:
NotCoD is a five part episodic parody of the Call of Duty series. An action-packed side-scrolling run'n'gun that's definitely not for children. A quintessentially British savaging of war, the media and the Catholic Church with Splitscreen Zombies included as standard, because we're nice that way.

Source: The Game Website.

200485.name: Rocket Fist
200485.description:
Rocket Fist is an arena game with crazy robots in chaotic rocket fist battles. Aim against your frenemies and prove your dexterity by killing each other with rocket propelled fists in this frenetic mix of dodgeball and billiards!

You can hold one Rocket Fist at a time and you only get one shot to throw your punch before having to run, hide and dodge to pick it back up! Just like in dodgeball, but with way more rockets! When you’re running away you can ninja dash around the arena, and if you’re feeling lucky you can try dash-bumping your friends in their faces to steal their rocket!

Easy to learn, hard to master, Rocket Fist’s quick rounds will keep you coming back for more. It’s the perfect game to bring out when your friends are over and in need of some explosive action!

Source: The Game Website.

200493.name: Enclave of the Exterminatus
200493.description:
From publisher blurb:

While enjoying a nice honey wine in the backwater community of Bench you discover citizens have been kidnapped from the surrounding area. After further investigation the mystery leads to a compound being built by the Exterminatus! With the danger mounting can the party slow the march of the evil cult and maybe pick up a few more pages of the arcane tome? Are they stealthy enough to infiltrate the stronghold? At almost 50 pages this adventure has the Precinct of Bench and the large compound of the Exterminatus each of which can be used in separate campaigns!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign.

200494.name: APA-L (Issue 535 - Aug 1975)
200494.description:
APA-L
535th Distribution
LASFS Meeting No. 1983
August 14, 1975

Published as PDF in 2016

200495.name: Aerial Reaches
200495.description:
From publisher blurb:

Davae Breon Jaxon's Cinematic Environs continues this new series of suppliments designed to help GMs paint vivid cinematic scenes for their players in a way that gives the environment its own unique character.

These environs can take a mundane encounter or location and turn it into an epic scene that the players will be talking about for year to come.

This fourth in the series deals with Aerial Environs. It discusses the effects of of things like altitude and falling, but also includes material related to aerial combat, chases, arcane hazards, sky pirates, new materials, and various modes of aerial transportation.

Now, instead of simply sending the party on an adventure to find a lost tomb, the GM can have the tomb located on a floating skyland (sky island). Instead of bandits along the road, the party now has to be on the lookout for death from above as wyvern-riding kobold pirates descend upon their aetherwood ship.

Also incuded is a new character background, new equipment, new weapons, new vehicles, new materials and a new magic items related to this particular environ.

200496.name: SK8 Pro
200496.description:
Welcome to the Intergalactic Skateboard Championship!
Competitors from various ghettos around the universe are gathering in the radical lanes of Drop Flip Zone.
Are you prepared to skateboard in the universe?

Sk8 Pro is a cardgame with dice. In the game, each player will have to be the most radical skater of the universe, trying to carry out their maneuvers and accumulate victories in a thrilling tournament. But be careful! Not everyone plays fair in this competition.

The game is about choose the right moves at the right time that may (or may not) be made by the skater using the dice result, choosing the best sponsorship and style, and the best time to disrupt your opponents.

Wins the game the player who accumulate three wins first.


O campeonato intergalático de skate esta começando!
Competidores de vários guetos do universo estão se reunindo nas pistas radicais em Drop Flip Zone.
Você esta preparado para encara o mundo do skate interestelar?

Sk8 Pro é um jogo de cartas e dados onde cada jogador terá que ser o skatista mais radical do universo, tentando realizar suas manobras e acumular vitórias num torneio empolgante. Mas cuidado! Nem todo mundo joga limpo nesta competição.

O jogo consiste em escolher as manobras certas no momento certo que poderão (ou não) ser realizadas, a partir da rolagem de dados, escolher o melhor patrocínio e a melhor hora de atrapalhar seus oponentes.

Vence o jogador que acumular três vitórias primeiro.

200497.name: APA-L (Issue 536 - Aug 1975)

200499.name: From Rage to Reason
200499.description:
A psychological teaching game that teaches how to deal with Rage and properly Reason.

From one of the rules sheets:

"Randy is in his late teenage years. He goes to school and also has a job. In the game, we will follow Randy through challenging situations that make Randy very angry. Randy's anger is not unusual, because these situations would make most people angry. It is the job of the players to give him advice on how to deal with these problems and achieve his goals. Players earn lots of play money for giving good advice.

The object of the game is to earn the most money. Play until the last Spark card is used or the instructor says that time is up, whichever comes first. Players choose a banker to give out the money. The banker receives no extra pay period

Nature of the game

This game is different from most board games. Players do not go around the board with their pawns. In fact, there are no pawns or dice. It is played more like a card game than a board game. Players play certain of their cards on each round, and the player who has played the best cards wins the "pot" (all the money on that round). The board serves as a playing surface and a presentation of the skills used in the game."

2-6 Players (More with team play)

200500.name: Thin Ice: Survival has never been so much fun
200500.description:
A 30 minute tile based game of artic survival for 2-6 players where it's every meeple for itself and even friendships have limits.

You move on an ever-diminishing ice sheet represented by the tiles whilst trying not to get stranded on a separated ice floe and drifting away. Make pacts, break pacts, laugh, despair and come face-to-face with the polar bear - survival has never been so much fun!

...and if that's not challenging enough, a deck of event cards brings an added level of dirty tricks, audacious actions and stress-relieving laughter.

The winner in Thin Ice termed the “survivor” is the last player to be able to keep moving on the ever shrinking ice. If you can’t keep moving then a dip into the sea becomes your last action and becoming separated on a single ice floe will be your final farewell to the group.
